ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Шуморење
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Шуморење is an experimental dungeon synth apparition by Patron Requiem, a project that exhales atmospheric black metal, funereal trap, orphaned rap echoes, and a mephistophelian dark ambient fog. It also stands as a side-project of tvnalad, known for post-black metal corroded by trap residues and mortuary rhythms.
There is a particular pleasure in wandering the cavernous underlevels of the Internet at pale hours, hunting for new diffuse and haunted sonic ecstasies, and suddenly colliding with something that feels both ancient and wrong. Patron Requiem emerges there, clutching a dust-choked dungeon synthesizer that sounds nostalgic, hypnotic, brittle, and strangely delicious. Very quickly, it becomes clear this is not traditional dungeon synth but a more hallucinogenic, wayward beast.
Yes, the venomous melancholy is present, that romantic spleen associated with old-school dark dungeon music, but it is infected by something else: instrumental trap stripped of all its celebratory instincts. Trap as a corpse. Rap cadavers drifting like unidentified remains through a slimy graveyard on a frozen wasteland.
The intrepid Serbian hand behind Patron Requiem touches something rare here, almost miraculous. Шуморење unfolds as a journey through enveloping mists that contaminate wandering minds, transmuting pathos into something dreamlike, funereal, and unexpectedly euphoric.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 29, 2026
Patron Requiem: Ghost-keys murmuring from tainted abysses and specter-guitars howling impossible caprices were briefly invoked inside the psychedelic donjon of your surreal orisons

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: A Curious Collection
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
The Mad Alchemist's Whispering Skull
If kept in a perfectly silent room one can hear the Mad Alchemist's whisperings.
The whisperings reveal many valuable secrets as well as many flights of fancy, usually intermingled.
A caution, all who have spent time listening to the skull have eventually gone mad themselves.
Endless Hourglass
As the name states, the sands of this hourglass never have fallen to an end.
None know what will happen if they do end.
Spectacles Of Stygian Sight
Allow one to see many entities who wish to remain hidden to plain sight.
It should be noted that many hidden entities do not take kindly to being seen.
Agrippa's Inkwell Of Maledictions
If filled with ink of the proper formulation,
any harm described befalling an individual,
no matter how grievous, will befall them.
There is currently no known record of the proper formulation of ink.
The Shawm of Dantalion
Significantly magnifies the player's natural abilities,
to the point where even one who has no skill whatsoever may deliver a virtuoso performance.
An Almanac of Secret Stars
Describes the natures of certain stars not visible to the naked eye nor the best spyglass,
where and when those stars may be located and seen,
and what benefits or detriments they may bring to enterprises carried out under their light.
-OLD MOTH DREAMS
---
A Curious Collection is a cracked reliquary from Old Moth Dreams, that extraordinary occult-drenched dungeon-synth aberration hatched somewhere beneath the damp stones of Providence, Rhode Island. Nothing hits quite like these phantasmal transmissions: pure and beautiful madness, a kind of corrupted neoclassical dungeon-noise delirium where Lovecraftian echoes slither through every pore and contaminate the whole lattice of sound.
Here, damned prog-rock atmospheres ooze like forgotten ectoplasms; surreal dark-ambient profanations whisper in broken tongues; psychedelic vapors coil and uncoil in slow, impossible geometries.
It is macabre, yes. It is unpredictable, certainly. It is schizophrenic fun from a parallel crypt—the sort of delirious sonic artifact you find only once in a lifetime, trembling in your hands, wondering how it got here… and why it seems to be breathing.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: A Surfeit of Lampreys
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A Surfeit of Lampreys invites the listener to a hyper-tonal, minimalist, and surreal banquet, where the mind is confronted with repetitions of celestial yet disturbed musical patterns. These figures interrogate one another, attempt replies, circle endlessly around a glittering, prehistoric metaphysical dilemma that refuses resolution.
This is cinema for the ears.
Imagine Steve Reich, Terry Riley, and Moondog composing the soundtrack to a utopian film about quantum physics and impossible birds gliding above a rediscovered Atlantis. Koyaanisqatsi submerged in a torrent of LSD. The music of SimCity, but reprogrammed by Man Ray and Giorgio de Chirico.
What emerges is a euphoric loop of beauty, fleeting yet eternal, strange, stubborn, and opaque. A deeply addictive unidentified sonic object, where disquiet entwines with flickering lights, tracing the unstable cartography of a destiny that will never cease to redraw itself.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released February 1, 2026

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: A Taste Of Eden
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
queer noise worshiping the female body
---
Errant Static is no longer as it once was.
The name lingers like a scorched afterimage, a residue of voltage and breath trapped in the walls. This formidable project of experimental noise, corrupted power electronics and ritualistic drone doom has released its final solo emissions, then quietly sealed that chapter away. Going forward, Errant Static will exist only in the margins: through collaborations and compilations, as a presence rather than a solitary voice. ECHØVEIL will forever carry the pride, and the wound, of having sheltered within its smoking entrails some of Errant Static’s most precious sonic relics. This project was, and remains, profoundly dear to me.
It is within this funereal silence that I am granted the tainted privilege of unveiling A Taste Of Eden, one of the artist’s final solo offerings. Four minimalist harsh queer noise pieces, slow-burning and hypnotic, essential in their restraint, almost liturgical in intent. Errant Static allows the sound to breathe, to settle, to fester, patiently shaping a corrupt and devotional atmosphere where decay feels deliberate, sacred even.
These noise-litanies unfold as a reverent homage to the feminine body in all its power, fragility, and radiance. Not representation, but invocation. Not violence, but surrender. The sound does not attack; it envelops, coils, whispers, and waits.
Taste without guilt.
Let yourself drift.
Absorb every second Errant Static prepared for us before withdrawing into the shadows.
The journey is slow, unsettling, and profoundly worth it.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

released January 4, 2026

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: A Threshold / Eine Schwelle
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A Threshold / Eine Schwelle, is the first split release by Gogol (AUS) and HELLBERG (DE).
Step through a dense, cold space, slow, heavy, without haste, without turning back.
Movement in the shadowy realm between threat and awe. Soundscapes like distant horizons, deep frequencies like subterranean rumblings. As if something immense were breathing in the darkness, and you can only hear its edges.
Yet beneath the weight lies something else: a fragile musicality, almost invisible, like light you do not see but feel. No salvation rather, a quiet suggestion that even darkness has structure, and that something can emerge from it.
- Gogol & HELLBERG
---
Two projects I hold close to the nerve, finally intertwined.
A split that breathes in slow spirals: hypnotic, nostalgic, quietly celestial. Four pieces, two per artist, suspended in that fragile corridor between states, where waking dissolves but sleep has not yet claimed the body. Night leaks into day. Thought becomes texture.
On the sealed underside of the eyelid, fading dreams begin to harden into something almost real. Not memory. Not illusion. Something adjacent.
Gogol and Hellberg guide this inward drift with remarkable precision, shaping an inner passage through contemplative drone, cosmic ambient, and a strain of surreal, noisy, frostbitten dungeon synth that feels both distant and intimately lodged beneath the skin.
A masterful convergence. A threshold crossed without noticing.
The naturalist soundtrack to Kepler-22 b.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released February 23, 2026
Gogol & HELLBERG : thresholds in sound, rearticulations of the unsayable, inner languages folding in on themselves, slight departures from stable planes, where celestial beauty flickers and something unnamed quietly falls away

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: A Worthy Decay
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Black smoke first. Not a cloud, not a metaphor. A total occupation. Vision erased, direction annulled, the idea of elsewhere burned out of the mind. A Worthy Decay begins already lost. Cosmic Fumes drags you into the smoke and lets go. No hand, no voice, no exit. Only density.
A single drone-doom mass, ambient in the way extinction is ambient, everywhere, unavoidable, without emphasis. The fire arrives without spectacle. It eats forests the same way it eats cities, patiently, evenly, without hatred. Buildings soften. Rivers forget their paths. Names dissolve. Souls follow.
This is not collapse. Collapse implies speed. This is consumption stretched thin, a long burn where everything learns how to disappear correctly. The smoke thickens until there is no longer a difference between breathing and surrender. Cosmic Fumes lets the tone persist long past meaning, long past resistance, until even despair loses its shape.
When the sound finally vanishes, there is no release. No opening. The silence is not empty space. It is confirmation. Proof that nothing continued, that nothing escaped, that nothing remains to listen. Not quiet. Not peace. The silence of inexistence, where even the memory of sound has been erased.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 2, 2026
Cosmic Fumes: samples, noises and sounds.
*Inspired by the smoked ambience blown by the great forest fires of west Canada this summer. I exhaled my anxiety trough art.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Abrasive Deluge
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Abrasive Deluge unfolds as a gravitational event rather than an album.
Conceived by Greek sound artist Substak, its core is a single, monumental composition of nearly twenty minutes. A continuous pressure field. An abrasive surge without shoreline or horizon. Listening becomes drift, erosion, surrender.
There is no narrative, only immersion.
A storm made of texture, density, and void.
Noise as weather. Silence as residue.
The sound mass grinds and blooms simultaneously, woven from fluctuating interferences, primordial cosmic snow, and mute, suspended tensions. The listener is pulled into an uncertain absence, a melancholic elsewhere where orientation collapses. Solitary, lunar, solemn. A state of quiet awe. A beatific dislocation.
Time loosens its grip. Molecules vibrate with an electricity older than memory. Every atom hums with a charge that predates form itself. Joy, doubt, vertigo, loss of bearings, all coexist in a single, slow continuum. One is nowhere, and everywhere, all at once.
The second piece emerges as an afterimage.
A phantom reflection.
Here, Sir Kuliktavikt intervenes not to repeat, but to unmake. The original mass is dismantled, diffused, haunted. A post-ambient deconstruction. A residue of the deluge, refracted through absence and echo. Sound becomes specter, debris, drifting anti-form. A navigation through forbidden skies, guided by a liquid compass, tracing ecstatic negations.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 27, 2026
Substak: brews abrasive weather from surrealistic entrails and impossible beauty
Sir Kuliktavikt: dines on the remains

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Abstractum et Obscurum
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Beneath ten thousand feet of earth, under a viscous swamp fat with refuse and half-eaten saints, lies the cathedral of Necromantic Nightmare’s Abstractum et Obscurum. Not built. Not carved. Secreted.
The marsh above it writhes, electrically gravid, colossal amphibians gnawing on seasoned fragments of the formerly human, their throats croaking psalms in a language that tastes like rust. The mud vibrates. The air foams. Everything sweats decomposition.
Inside, all groans. All sags. All rots.
The organ does not play. It expectorates black mire. Each note is a deliberate drowning, lungs filling with tar, a choir of eyeless putrefacts chanting fever-hymns to a god who molted centuries ago. The pews are split ribs. The aisle is a throat. Gigantic white worms promenade with sacerdotal calm, whispering atrocities into the cracks of the wood, glutting themselves on dead-star syrup and damp soot. They do not crawl. They administer.
At the altar, a priest with a bifurcated crystal tongue caresses the cadaver of a bird while carving his cheeks with a blade that emits a radiance unknown to physics, unknown to mercy. He laughs. He sobs. He convulses in jubilation, vomiting prayers to anti-time, to retrograde eternities that gnash their teeth backward.
Mirrors liquefy. Stained glass hemorrhages dried blood. The architecture rejoices in its own collapse, beams bending like vertebrae eager to snap. Everything celebrates rot as revelation.
And beneath the church, deeper still, an immense eye sleeps. Closed. Trembling. Dreaming of hinges.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Alzheimer's Disease at 13 Years Old Caused by Drug
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Wasted Existence. One track. Fifteen minutes. Noise as disorientation.
Concrete music adrift, abrasive and unmoored. A rough sonic collage of total perdition.
Analog ghosts devouring your dreams, your nightmares, your aspirations, your griefs, your joys, only to regurgitate them as emptied fragments, stripped of meaning.
A journey to the end of the night.
A rust-colored night, reeking of sulfur and torn-open heavy machinery.
Rust blood.
The sobbing of absence.
To de-exist.
To self-vomit.
The brain committing harakiri.
Devil’s plunderphonics.
Telephone conversations between two sighing corpses.
End of transmission.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: An Obituary for A.S. (dedicated to the sound genius Alan Splet)
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
It sounds like a house of crushed glass spinning inside an antimatter vortex, installed in an inverted echo chamber, lodged in Salvador Dalí’s crystal nostril, sealed within the coffin of a damned homeless man, dressed in a shirt stitched from smoked human flesh, lit by a cigarette that is alive and refuses extinction.
This description is inaccurate.
All descriptions are.
Why is the baby crying?
Why are the dogs barking?
Why is the water electric?
Why is the piano speaking to my dreams?
Have you ever been to Crouch End?
Corridors without exits.
Rooms catalogued but never entered.
The human black hole in my garden wants to lick the flesh from my bones.
Paranoia becomes procedural.
Alan is smiling from beyond the grave.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

existent/nonexistent is a sound artist/experimental musician, audio engineer and photographer based out of Canada. existent/nonexistent creates his ‘musical’ pieces and soundscapes at his studio, Abattoir Studios, in Victoria, BC, Canada.
existent/nonexistent uses a wide variety of synthesizers, organs/keyboards, samplers, found sounds, field recordings, feedback, contact microphone noise box, prepared guitar, electric guitar and bass, piano and theremin in his musical pieces.
existent/nonexistent transcends all musical genres from: sound art, sound collage, musique concrete, experimental, electro-acoustic, noise, noise rock, lowercase, drone/ ambient and minimalism.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: (anti)Music For Mass Extinction
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A requiem for everything that once dared to breathe.
A choir of rusted sirens, whispering into the vacuum left by vanished suns.
Here, melody is a fossil—memory decaying beneath the static of uncreation.
The machines hum like dying gods; the winds remember names no one can speak.
Beauty still flickers, trembling and emaciated, beneath the ash.
It is the final call of an extinct songbird echoing through the circuitry of the end.
A lamentation without audience, without hope—
and yet, impossibly, still radiant in its despair.
(anti)Music For Mass Extinction:
not music, but its aftermath.
Not life, but the ghost of its resonance.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
----
You have heard said that Humanity is the Devil. In fact, Humanity had become something much worse. A Cancer, a toxic, tumorous poison that had grown and metastasized in the bloodstream of the Earth, gourging itself off the fat of the land and leaving nothing but an emaciated hollowed out shell of life behind. A Cancer belching carcinogenic soot and petrochemicals from its plastic lungs. A sick parody of The Natural Order of Creation, an Abomination.
"Now in the people that were meant to be green there is no more life of any kind. There is only shriveled barrenness. The winds are burdened by the utterly awful stink of evil, selfish goings-on. Thunderstorms menace. The air belches out the filthy uncleanliness of the peoples. The earth should not be injured! The earth must not be destroyed!" - Hildegard Of Bingen
Revelation 8:10 - 11
10 And the third angel sounded, and there fell a great star from heaven, burning as it were a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers, and upon the fountains of waters; 11 And the name of the star is called Wormwood: and the third part of the waters became wormwood; and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.
"The Earth should not be injured. The Earth must not be destroyed. As often as the elements of the World are violated by ill treatment, so God will cleanse them. God will cleanse them through the sufferings and hardships of humankind. All of creation God gives to humankind to use. But if this privilege is misused, then God permits creation to punish humanity." - Hildegard Of Bingen
Revelation 21
1 Then I saw a New Heaven and a New Earth, for the first Heaven and the first Earth had passed away, and the sea was no more.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Apart Delight
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Apart Delight opens like a door that should have remained sealed.
Terrible dreams accumulate behind the eyes. Withered hauntings. Schizoid derailments. The simple act of existing becomes an offense punished by sound. Ikunaa does not compose drones so much as cultivate them, slow-growing acoustic fungi that seep into walls, nerves, memories. This is a world darker than black, a place where hope has entered its terminal phase and continues breathing only out of spite.
The drone melts souls. It haunts and is haunted in return. It rots matter, corrodes identities, eats through steel, skin, language. Soot-creatures rise from the ground and drift into a sky with unstable geometry, where clouds grin and crackle with morbid electricity. Vegetation turns sickly and bioluminescent, creeping across cities like a deliberate infection, swallowing streets, buildings, bedrooms. A mortuary-city emerges, populated by warped children who stare without blinking.
On every lamppost, a dog’s head has been mounted like a warning or a prayer gone wrong. Blood, still warm, drips onto the pavement in slowed time, as if the world itself is reluctant to finish the gesture. Each sound is another nail, driven patiently into an already bruised mind. The cortex floods with the impossible. Lovecraftian immensities press inward, announcing madness not as a future event but as a present condition.
Apart Delight is not an album. It is an inhabitable dread. Entering it means consenting to erosion. Leaving it means carrying something back with you.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 24, 2026
Ikunaa: Eternal dread distilled into sound.
ikunaa.bandcamp.com
Please consider purchasing something from Ikunaa's Bandcamp. His whole discography is amazing.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Audax
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Audax. The Latin word for bold; reckless. As these sounds were forming, I realized they sounded like engines churning and scraping. Great mechanical interactions. Maybe I was angry. Maybe I was sad. Whatever the cause, the beasts are here now, working low on fuel. My soul is free to let the sounds rush me to and fro. The noise is searching and moving. Repetitively restless.
-Saint Elisabeth
---
We continue our excavation of the noise-ridden past of sound artist Saint Elisabeth with this third reissue in our series devoted to tracing his discographic trajectory. This time, listeners are invited to immerse themselves in Audax, an album originally released in early 2025.
It marked a departure of sorts.
Here, sound is no longer invoked as invocation or ritual, but reshaped, stripped down, and re-forged into something purely mechanical. Rusted car engines grind and idle inside an echo chamber suspended in a near-infinite void. Poisoned pistons throb like overheated hearts, locked in a perpetual state of imminent failure. What emerges are the industrial entrails of a city without a soul, without intent, without redemption.
These sounds search, but never arrive. They grope forward, hesitate, question themselves, then collapse endlessly back into their own debris. Motion without progress. Force without meaning. A closed circuit of pressure and fatigue.
If earlier works sought the absolute through biblical figures and fractured theology, Audax turns instead toward a colder axis. The absolute is no longer divine, but mechanical. It resides in the sterile purity of a turbine spinning endlessly, tirelessly, for no reason at all. A machine worshipping its own momentum. An indifferent engine replacing the absent (?) god.
Deus ex machina.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 29, 2026
Saint Elisabeth: sounds

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Autoganzfeld Reeducation
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Spaghetti Blacc finally breaches the perimeter of ECHØVEIL. A total artist, a surrealist rap prodigy who may at any moment mutate into black metal smeared with no wave scabs and power electronics afterburn. Commitment level: catastrophic. With Spaghetti Blacc, you never know where the ground is, or if there ever was one. Feints, trapdoors, ecstatic disorientation. Pure euphoric derailment.
On Autoganzfeld Reeducation, a record as dionysian as it is luciferian, the listener is force-fed a degenerate tasting menu prepared by a deranged chef with a scorched palate and no regard for structural integrity. Noise-rock hallucinations that feel like an illicit graft between early-era Michael Gira’s Swans, Japanese Zeuhl geniuses Koenji Hyakkei and John Zorn’s Naked City, still twitching, still bleeding. Brutal, incandescent avant-prog spasms colliding with feral folk aberrations worthy of a Henry Cow fever dream. A kind of dying Exotica, sickly and sunburnt, packed with rattling bolts, unstable voltages, and frequencies that refuse to stay put.
Elsewhere, anti-jazz erupts in flesh-eating castanet rituals. A slinky solo combusts mid-performance. Schizo-psychedelic death metal sloshes around in boiling fryer oil. Vectorial harsh noise siphons your grey matter through a straw carved from human bone. Black metal appears briefly, imagined by a short circuit, then self-immolates. Nothing behaves. Everything convulses. Genres are chewed, liquefied, spat back as hostile matter.
Autoganzfeld Reeducation is not an album so much as a neurological incident, a reprogramming by excess, a carnival of ruptures disguised as entertainment. Pleasure for the whole family, provided the family has already abandoned hope, reason, and the comfort of recognizable form
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released December 28, 2025
Spaghetti Blacc: everything (and then some)
spaghettiblacc.bandcamp.com/music

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Before the Burial
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
“Before the Burial” drifts in like a vespéral fever, a slow exhalation from some forgotten crypt-machine humming beneath the Australian night. For twelve delirious minutes, Gogol sculpts a dungeon synth séance: languid, nocturnal, trembling with a tension that seems to pulse through the walls like trapped breath. Shards of horror-tinged synthwave surface and sink again—John Carpenter’s The Thing staring back from the frost—while industrial-leaning percussion begins to rattle like loose bones in a rusted centrifuge.
It is a perfect aberration: a modern atmospheric dungeon synth ritual crossbred with the hyperspeed ghosts of an amphetamine-charged ’80s sci-fi soundtrack. The piece rises, rises again, climbing through a sibylline, adulterated night where every shadow feels spiked with teeth. And then—silence. A fracture in the world. A voice from the cult-classic film Carnival of Souls takes center stage, murmuring despair, detachment, that slow unthreading from a reality that no longer remembers your name.
And suddenly we’re dragged back under. The tension coils tighter, the synths grow heavier, more contagious, beating like a diseased aurora. Beneath the surface: an almost subliminal black-metal current, whispering through the circuitry like a parasite learning to dream.
A masterfully controlled descent—fascinating, phantasmic, and atmospherically prodigious.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Black Crypt Necromancy
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A live improvisational recording on Mabon 2025 — a decomposing ritual in shifting darkness.
---
Black Crypt Necromancy is an uncompromising noise improvisation, broadcast live from the putrescent crypt of Graveyard Witchcraft. A decomposing corpse wired directly into the power grid, convulsing under raw voltage. Slabs of rancid flesh detonate beneath the electrical onslaught of a necrophagous anti-music, telluric and corrupted, forever teetering on the brink of collapse in every numb, swollen second.
Femurs soften and melt. Viscera smoke, exhaling psychotropic vapors that crawl through the air like hallucinated incense. White maggots wander freely across the mound of moribund, grey-pink flesh, laying metallic eggs in the humus of what was once human. This is depraved noise. Night-noise. Noise born in the damp, glowing depths of a crypt, where sound ferments, pulses, and rots slowly, beautifully, beyond recognition.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Black Noise Constellation
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
the black noise is the sonic concept and constellation is the abstract,space structure of drones
-Substak
---
An astral fever-dream mapped in ghostlight, humming with the residue of extinct oscillations.
Five hypnotic vortices from the ultra-prolific Substak: space ambient, drone, liminal drift… the slow evaporation of thought in a vacuum older than memory. These are sound-rifts where you dissolve, where the mind becomes a wandering satellite, bruised by cosmic frost, haunted by the echo of forgotten telemetry.
The textures bloom like decayed frequencies, like relic signals from derelict space stations lost to entropy. Yet there is comfort here, a strange warmth in the void — the feeling of floating through an abandoned nebula that still remembers your name.
Black Noise Constellation is a dark and immersive descent into far-away space:
an astral labyrinth of half-extinguished stars, slow gravitational hymns, and shadow-tasting atmospheres.
A place where the universe hums in its sleep… and invites you to vanish into its dream.
Following these five abyssal transmissions come two remixes by UgUrGkuliktavikt, where the hauntological and psychedelic DNA of Substak’s originals is dragged through Sir Kuliktavikt’s hallucinogenic prism. The tracks are deconstructed, atomized, re-assembled into unstable dream-machines — spectral pulses, fractured drones, and echo-fogged rituals that amplify the original cosmic dread while mutating it into something even stranger, more delirious, more beautifully unhinged.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released November 16, 2025
Substak : Cartographer of starless drone abysses, mumbling oracles siphoned from the echoing lungs of distant suns.
Sir Kuliktavikt : mastering and remixes.
substak.bandcamp.com
ugurgkuliktavikt.bandcamp.com
----
Substak, is an Athens-based artist who began his journey in 2011.
His passion for music provided an escape from everyday life, and since then, he has released his work through various labels.
Substak’s artistic vision transcends conventional boundaries, focusing on the pure language of sound.
His journey continues to evolve, driven by a commitment to creative freedom and expression
You can regularly find Substak on grey clay radio with his show ANALYSIS:  www.greyclayradio.com/schedule
----
UgUrGkuliktavikt is an experimental music project initiated in 2020 by an artist based in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. Since its inception, the project has carved a path through some of the most esoteric corners of sound exploration, releasing its first full-length album in 2022. With a prolific stream of releases that defy easy categorization, UgUrGkuliktavikt dwells in liminal sonic spaces, where genre boundaries dissolve into a dense fog of texture, atmosphere, and dissonance.
The project’s music spans a vast and often unsettling spectrum—ranging from dark ambient and drone to musique concrète, harsh noise wall, dungeon synth, funereal ambient, industrial, hauntological collage, and plunderphonics. Each release feels like a transmission from a decaying world, built on fragments of sound both ancient and modern, sacred and profane. The project frequently incorporates field recordings, degraded samples, lo-fi synth work, and aural decay as aesthetic tools, constructing immersive audio narratives that evoke loss, memory, spectral presence, and metaphysical dread.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Breaking the Ice I
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
New Paranoised album, exploring breakcore/jungle and drum n bass!!!
First ten tracks are drum n bass and the last eleven are breakcore/jungle. Choose what you want to listen first. Enjoy!
-Paranoised
---
Paranoised returns to ECHØVEIL RECORDS.
But do not expect a continuation. IX now feels like a distant transmission, a corrupted memory buried under layers of static and time.
The early electronic deliriums are gone.
The haunted musique concrète has evaporated.
What remains is motion. Fracture. Velocity.
This new album dives headfirst into a feral, euphoric hybrid of breakcore, jungle and drum & bass, pushed far beyond nostalgia or genre revival. Twenty-one short but explosive pieces unfold like a trance mechanism in permanent overload, each track snapping, mutating, collapsing into the next with nervous precision.
You are dragged into frozen fogbanks of rhythm, disoriented and exhilarated, dancing while your own physical presence feels unstable, reprogrammed, psychotronically reshaped. Beats stutter and surge like faulty nervous impulses. Basslines breathe, sweat, convulse. Time dissolves into pure forward momentum.
Here, the ghosts of 90s rave culture are not resurrected but transfigured, stripped of comfort and irony, reborn as something uncanny and alive. Paranoised does not quote the past, it rewires it.
A vertiginous, body-warping release from one of the most compelling and singular sonic architects currently at work.
Welcome back to the fog.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 7, 2026
Paranoised : sleepwalking through impossible frozen jungles, whispering the true names of abandoned bass-gods.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Chthonic Gateway
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Ka’Bael, the Orlando-based dungeon synth entity, stands among the most fascinating and relentlessly prolific figures of this polymorphic underground. Rooted deep in the ancestral soil of dungeon synth, the project both honors the genre’s ossified foundations and corrodes them from within, threading in hypnotic experimental noise like venom through mortar. This is musical sorcery in its purest form. Gothic, vampiric, poisonous. A sound that seduces even as it suffocates.
Through Ka’Bael’s possessed analog keys, the Great Old Ones crawl back into resonance. They rise from granular ash, seep into the mind, contaminate thought, and drink the soul dry. An unspeakable fog rolls in and refuses to lift. Life collapses into catacombs and impious fissures, a profaned earth crawling with impossible geometries and creatures that leak into reality itself. Elongated faces. Bared canines. Vampires stripped of all modern romance, reduced to hunger and rot.
This is a Middle Ages from another dimension. Darker. More putrid. More merciless. A medieval nightmare refracted through Lovecraftian dread and corroded tape hiss, where splendor and decay are fused beyond separation.
A monumental work of shadowed art, both intoxicating and crushing. Enter the gateway, but do not expect to return unchanged.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Corrupted Stargazer
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
It begins like a séance held in a burned-out chapel — a trembling, spectral voice rising from the ashes of Bob Dylan’s “Visions of Johanna.” A ghost-folk rendition so fragile it could vanish if you breathe too loud. But then the ground splits open... And from the ruins emerges a delirious avalanche of sound collage and auditory sabotage.
Loops melt, echoes cannibalize each other, broken pop refrains flicker like dying satellites. Violet Stargazer drags melody through the underworld, reanimating it into something unrecognizable yet strangely divine. This is DECONSTRUCTIST MAXIMALIST POP NOISE — pure sonic hysteria sculpted from chaos. A labyrinth of haunted samples, schizophrenic harmonies, and fragmented beauty clawing its way through the static.
Everything here is too much, and yet it all fits together with obscene grace. It’s a dizzying descent into postmodern reverie — a love letter written in distortion, to the ghosts of music itself.
Unpredictable. Beautiful. Deranged. Essential.
The corrupted stargazer sings, and the cosmos trembles.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: ďábelkříž
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Three tracks. Three wounds. Three mirrors shattering inside the same black pulse.
A sound so harsh and loud — yet, strangely atmospheric, ambient-drone... psychedelic and surrealist even.
Luciferian Machine Music.
A cathedral imploding in slow motion.
A ritual of entropy, bound to no rhythm but decay itself.
Textures eat each other, feedback breeds in its own shadow, distortion becomes flesh.
Rotting flesh.
Somewhere inside the swarm of frequencies, you begin to smell the light.
It tastes like burnt copper and wet nails.
A fever hallucination of drone and horror —
psychedelia seen through the eyes of a dying insect.
There is no redemption here.
Only the ecstatic collapse of the listener, nailed to the devil’s geometry.
A sonic crucifixion in perpetual motion —
three wounds bleeding feedback into the mouth of eternity.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Datura
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Datura is a short-form offering where Inhum’An turns his attention toward the night-blooming logic of poisonous flowers. Named after the Datura genus, a family of Solanaceae whose roots spread from Mexico and the American Southwest to temperate and tropical soils worldwide, this EP unfolds like a quiet botanical rite.
Each of the four tracks is devoted to a distinct species, not as a literal portrait but as a state of mind. Mystery drifts in slowly. Calm is laced with unease. Beauty and toxicity breathe from the same stem. The result is a gently disorienting experience, serene yet troubling, like a lucid dream with a dark aftertaste.
Listeners drawn to the early, more introspective phases of Aphex Twin and Autechre will find familiar echoes here, refracted through Inhum’An’s own experimental techno sensibility.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Dead Voices
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Ghost Voices is an unstable document.
A ritual was initiated in darkness by Austrian sound artist Fabio Keiner. Whether it was intended as music, invocation, or simple listening remains unclear. Dark electronics were configured as receivers. Drones were sustained beyond safe duration. Frequencies were left unattended. Something answered.
Voices entered the system without authorization. Not the dead as remembered, but the dead as interrupted processes, consciousness caught mid-collapse. They speak through corrosion, looping interference, and ritualistic pulses that resemble breath only by accident. Some voices beg. Others document. Most repeat, endlessly, the instant they realized they were gone.
WARNING:
There are reports of listeners feeling accompanied long after playback has ended.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 17, 2026
Fabio Keiner: forsaken sounds leaking in from elsewhere
fabiokeiner.bandcamp.com

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: demo III
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Two long-form emissions ooze through the cracks, stretched and feverish, as if time itself had softened and begun to leak. What you hear is not composition but decomposition. A pair of extended expulsions, dragged up from a bruised elsewhere where sound rots before it is born.
The signal is clearer now. This other world, circlum pravitatis putrida (repeat it eternally while munching on dead flies and black soil), is slowly invading our reality, inch by inch, corrupting it, tarnishing it. To the worms’ delight.
Black metal here is no longer a genre but a necrotic reflex. Strings sag like wet ligaments, detuned to the point of nausea, drowning beneath avalanches of corrosive noise that hiss, choke, and swarm. Rhythm appears only to be devoured seconds later. Structure flickers like a dying insect trapped in amber made of ash.
These two tracks do not progress.
They fester.
They circle themselves like infected wounds, swelling, collapsing, reopening. Motifs melt. Distortion curdles.
Ildjarn, Striborg, Μνήμα, Abruptum, Wold, Bakbakwalanooksiwae, Emit, Reverorum Ib Malacht, T.O.M.B., and Gnaw Their Tongues collapse into one another, their laughing corpses molding into a new depraved, monstrous entity. Tentacles burst outward. Teeth everywhere. Smiling. Licking. Vicious. Wanting.
izprijenostь does not offer music.
It offers contamination.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Derelicta
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A signal adrift in stellar rust. Pulses of forgotten machinery echo through the skin of collapsed suns. Derelicta hums like a derelict temple orbiting nowhere — a drone of slow erosion, a murmur of black wind folding over itself.
From Utah’s deserts of circuitry and shadow, Errant Static channels the sound of unbeing. Since 2023 she has traversed the ruins of harsh noise, the viscera of power electronics, the sinking gravities of drone and sludge — building not worlds, but aftermaths.
These recordings are exhalations of dust and instinct, performed live and left to decay in real time. They flow as if time had lost its hinges, each track a corridor into the next — imperfect, wounded, luminous only in its desolation.
Derelicta is not light but its absence: the slow bloom of darkness behind the eyelids of dying stars. A sonic mirage collapsing into silence — the echo of something that never wanted to exist.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Detent
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Introducing experimental Australian sound artist Michael Baum to ECHØVEIL RECORDS.
Detent is a three-part composition that unfolds with quiet resolve, distilling an atmosphere that is at once austere and strangely comforting. Built from the patient interplay of early electronic and electroacoustic sensibilities, sustained drones, and finely tuned microtonal tensions, the work moves like a slow mechanism releasing pressure little by little, settling into a suspended trance. Each section feels deliberate and measured, allowing subtle shifts in texture and harmony to surface over extended durations, rewarding close and immersive listening.
As a complement to this new work, this first release on ECHØVEIL also gathers two earlier pieces by Michael Baum, drawn from select releases on the exceptional Montreal-based netlabel Musique Moléculaire.
musiquemoleculaire.bandcamp.com
These additional tracks offer a broader glimpse into his sonic vocabulary, revealing the continuity of his approach: a careful sculpting of sound where restraint becomes expressive, and minimal gestures resonate with depth.
Together, these pieces form a cohesive listening experience, situating Michael Baum’s work at the crossroads of introspective electronics and meditative sonic architecture.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Diablerie
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Each track of Diablerie unfolds as a warped black mass, captured through rust-eaten transistors and retransmitted by failing machines that barely remember their original purpose. The sound oscillates between scorching and glacial, a destabilizing vertigo where death industrial collapses into drone-synth hallucinations, where structure decays in real time.
There are no songs here, only rituals in various stages of decomposition. Circuits gasp, rhythms stumble and disintegrate, frequencies rot from the inside. Something ancient moves beneath the noise, not quite demonic, not quite mechanical, as if the machines themselves had inherited a memory of blasphemy.
Listening to Diablerie is a perpetual fall. Not ecstatic. Not liberating. Merely inevitable. A surrender to gravity, to entropy, to the quiet certainty that the mass will continue long after the listener has stopped resisting.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Dream Vessel
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
William Covert arrives on ECHØVEIL RECORDS ! Dream Vessel is the much anticipated follow-up to Dream Void, which was released last year on Musique Moléculaire:
musiquemoleculaire.bandcamp.com/album/dream-void
Still operating at the crossroads of avant-prog, free improvisation, cinematic ambient, synthwave and restless math-rock, Covert pushes the trio format into tighter, more kinetic forms. The collaborative tracks strike with coiled precision, knotty rhythms snapping into place before dissolving again, recalling the nervous intelligence of Grails, the fractal logic of King Crimson’s ProjeKcts, or Battles caught mid-calculation. These pieces feel engineered and feral at once, muscles flexing beneath shifting time signatures.
In contrast, the solo and more ambient passages fold inward. Here, Covert drifts into a haunted suspension, sculpting vaporous soundfields from analog synths, spectral overtones, and slow-moving harmonic residue. The synthwave influence surfaces as a kind of submerged memory, nocturnal and blurred, less neon than afterimage. Drums, Covert’s primary instrument, still surface in these pieces, not as propulsion but as pulse, fascinating, riveting, hypnotic, the heartbeat of an unstable dream engine threatening to stall or overheat.
Dream Vessel is another remarkable transmission from a singular musician, composer, and sonic architect, a record that breathes, recalibrates, and slowly reprograms the listener from the inside.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

-Spectre Horsemen, Pale With Dust
---
Spectre Horsemen, Pale With Dust erupts from the mildew-saturated catacombs with Dub For The National Health, a rewired, re-poisoned, re-dreamed mutation of last June’s already-terminal Trepanation For The National Health.
Except now the music crawls on broken limbs. Now the bass has teeth. Now the air stinks of violet combustion and collapsing timelines.
VIOLET SMOKE / VIOLET SMOKE / VIOLET SMOKE —
drifting like narcotic ectoplasm through your lungs, turning your nerves into sparking copper threads.
Ten thousand tons of psychotropic fog fall directly onto your skull. Your skull cracks, politely at first, then with obscene laughter.
The illbient monsters are here again — or were they ever gone?
Jaw hinges of molten steel, clattering in the roasted dark, dripping neon drool onto your trembling heartbeat.
Their voices are drowned sirens, reversed prayers, basslines sharpened into surgical blades.
Your stomach fills with a glacial fire.
Your grin widens. Wider. Wider.
You cough up corrupted sub-bass, rusted bolts fused to cartilage, spider corpses twitching with residual electricity. A hundred. A thousand. They scatter like cracked stars.
Everything spins.
Everything leers.
Everything hums with that sickening, exhilarating frequency that only the truly damned can love.
CUT / CUT / CUT-UP:
visions of Scorn mutating into Godflesh collapsing into Andy Stott exploding inside DJ Spooky recombining through Andrew Nolan dissolving into The Bug splitting into Techno Animal into into into Scientist's brain—
A glitching bestiary of industrial ghosts dances behind your eyelids.
You can’t tell if you're hallucinating or if hallucinations are now hallucinating you. Maybe both. Maybe none.
The city dissolves.
The city rots.
The city becomes a swollen black lung pumping vapor-drugs directly into your bloodstream.
Rain tastes like burnt circuitry.
Streetlamps ooze marrow.
Your shadow whispers advice you cannot trust.
And yet — god, the thrill —
that ecstatic dread, that trembling euphoria,
the promise that you're about to exceed the perimeter of your own mind and never find the way back.
Dub For The National Health is not music; it is contraband from another dimension, a ritual stimulant smuggled through ruptured realities, a black-mass narcotic engineered for brains that no longer fear the consequences.
A warning, then:
This album moves on its own.
This album watches you.
This album will change your chemistry.
And you will beg it for more.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Duologie Féline
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
And now... for something completely different, we have the enigmatic Akhalis, multi-instrumentalist conjured from the psychotropic mists of Saint Eustache, Québec.
Duologie Féline unites two sprawling works—Chaton and Papatte—each a pair of entwined, long-form suites that stretch and curl like smoke through infinite dimensions. Here, sound dissolves, folds, and refracts in a kaleidoscopic haze of psychedelic incantations: a liminal plane where ambient experimentation collides with LSD-drenched post-rock, mushroom-spun prog, opiate-laden drone-noise, and cosmic shoegaze. Each note vibrates like the heartbeat of an unseen cosmos, each texture hums with the intelligence of a dreaming animal, each swell of sound opens a doorway to a deeper, wilder perception.
Listening to Duologie Féline is like wandering through a four-dimensional feline documentary, hallucinated from within the collective dream-minds of Syd Barrett-era Pink Floyd, My Bloody Valentine, Daniel Johnston, Flying Saucer Attack, Taj Mahal Travellers, Thurston Moore, Gong, Roy Montgomery, Sunburned Hand of the Man and The Jewelled Antler Collective—only this one exists in color beyond human vision, in time beyond linear measure. One moment you float amid glittering cat-eye constellations, the next you drift through forests of sonic moss and liquid shadow, hearing the whisper of fur against unseen leaves, the murmur of tails brushing astral currents.
This is music to melt into, dissolve within, and surrender yourself to—a cosmic catnap of hypnotic waves, spiraling drones, fractured melodies, and strobing dreamlight. It is at once intoxicating, bewildering, comforting, and unsettling, a full immersion into a world where feline grace guides you through endless rooms of impossible sonic architecture.
Best approached with a generous helping of catnip, a mind unbound, and the willingness to lose all sense of space, time, and reason.
Long live Akhalis!
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Duty Cycle
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Michael Baum is back on ECHØVEIL with a new fascinating EP.
What we have here are two vast drone structures breathe at an inhuman interval, locked into a rhythm that resembles work rather than music. Not labor in the human sense, but mechanical persistence. Systems humming long after their architects have vanished. Circuits maintaining function inside buildings that are no longer occupied by meaning.
Baum treats sound like a static load applied to failing architecture. Frequencies press downward, patiently, testing beams and joints. Nothing snaps. Nothing resolves. Instead, everything remains suspended in a terminal phase of erosion. Walls remember being walls. Columns still hold, though they no longer believe in gravity. This is drone as infrastructure fatigue.
There is a calm here, but it is the calm of a control room with no operators left. A meditative stasis saturated with corrosion. Time stretches, thins, oxidizes. The listener’s perception slows until it aligns with rust, dust, and the silent negotiations between metal and air. Thought itself begins to behave like a decaying material.
Duty Cycle is stillness weaponized. Zen filtered through structural decay. A drone record that does not move forward, but inward, toward a permanent state of slow, beautiful disintegration.
These drones do not hypnotize by movement, but by immobility. They reduce the mind to a static component inside a larger failing system. Awareness becomes structural. Emotional response is replaced by load, pressure, tolerance. You do not listen to Duty Cycle so much as you are gradually calibrated by it.
Industrial traces surface only as residues. Ghost voltages. Subsonic maintenance signals echoing through abandoned conduits. No aggression, no catharsis. Only the soft violence of endless operation. A loop without climax. A process that continues because stopping was never specified.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

archive.org/details/HHFBC_fbc.pf.f01.078p
-Nonentity
---
CYLINDER.
Historical documents.
Almost erased.
Re-erected in the silky hand of a mad and brilliant sound painter.
Insects?
Do I hear insects?
No.
It is the sound of erasure.
Of what survives time once it has been eaten, gnawed through.
Ghosts of the cylinders.
Concrete dada.
Proto-psychedelic residue.
I always forget myself in the immemorial dust.
The train toward erasure departs at six o’clock.
It is a gigantic, schizophrenic gramophone.
Sooty steam leaks from its walls of cylindrical flesh.
I spiral out.
My brain.
My mouth.
It leaks.
Like cylinders melting under the midnight sun.
You must eat the wagons.
Eat the station grounds.
And drink cylinder juice to truly understand.
I want to understand.
I love.
I love.
I love.
Two tracks.
Nothing else sounds like this.
NOTHING.
ELSE.
It is sound remembering itself incorrectly.
A medium hallucinating its own extinction.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: ECHØVEIL RADIO VOLUME 1 – Séraphitüs-Séraphîta
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Sir Kuliktavikt steps into the ether with the first volume of Echøveil, a monthly radio apparition. Not so much a “show” as a shifting corridor of sound, where genres slip out of their cages and dissolve into luminous smoke. Expect a delirium of textures—psychedelic avant-rock, weird psych, dub-tribal techno, dream folk, musique concrète, dreamy dungeon synth, harsh noise, shoegaze, raw black metal, sound collage, no wave, progressive rock, soul, trippy Tropicália, anatolian rock, ghostly drones. My tastes fracture like mirrors, and each month I will serve a new banquet: sometimes serene, sometimes vertiginous, always trembling with uncanny light.
Every transmission is also haunted by a guest. Each episode closes with a mix from a sound-artist I revere, a voice I carry like a secret talisman. For this inaugural broadcast (September, released October 1st, because time never behaves), I have the honour of presenting a spectral mix by the brilliant Séraphitüs-Séraphîta—visionary, genius, dear friend.
And more than sound: the entire visual body of Echøveil is conjured by Séraphitüs-Séraphîta. Their artwork—logos, banners, cover-images—feels like sigils dredged from submerged dreams: letters stretched into runes, veils of oceanic texture, shadow-webs that look alive, as if spun by invisible hands. These images do not simply accompany the sounds—they are part of the transmission itself, echoing on the edge of vision the same way music echoes in the ear.
This is only the beginning. Each month, another guest will pass through, another glyph will unfurl, another voice will warp the silence. Step into the veil, and lose yourself in its shifting corridors.
Please check Blacksmith Noise Records, the FANTASTIC netlabel managed by Séraphitüs-Séraphîta and Saint Elisabeth

blacksmithnoiserecords.bandcamp.com

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: ECHØVEIL RADIO VOLUME 2 – Hystalgia (Flowering Shrubs)
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
ECHØVEIL RADIO // VOLUME II — THE HALLOWEEN SEANCE
The tower flickers again. Somewhere in the fog, a switch is thrown by an invisible hand. Static breathes. Tape warps. A voice — yours, mine, ours — spirals through the ruinous frequencies.
Sir Kuliktavikt, esteemed curator of ghost transmissions, unseals the second chamber of ECHØVEIL RADIO — tonight steeped in a phosphorescent decay, a Halloween not of this Earth.
No pumpkins smiling politely. No plastic fangs. No jingling skeletons from the dollar store.
Only the mad hum of dying machines, the wet pulse of the grave, the inverted carnival behind your eyelids.
And in the heart of this broadcast — Hystalgia emerges, veiled in amber hallucination.
Known for his transcendent project Flowering Shrubs — that strange garden where Freak Folk and Atmospheric Raw Black Metal entwine like two serpents in dream.
Where Hypnagogic Pop melts into rain-soaked tape hiss, where Outsider hymns stumble through fog, barefoot and luminous.
Where a broken acoustic guitar hums beside a dying synthesizer, both singing of childhood, decay, and forbidden light.
The Shrubs bloom in strange colors — pink noise, amber silence, spectral greens never meant for human eyes.
Tonight, the radio becomes a séance.
A delirious carousel of lo-fi psych, musique concrète, horrorcore, and mouldy drone.
Fragments of Giallo soundtracks drift through cryptic tunnels of reverb.
A crazy, demented organ screams hymns to the moon.
Dungeon noise and death rock slither beneath the floorboards.
Pumpkin synths wobble like diseased lanterns.
You may even hear your own breath, looping back through the static.
This is not your grandfather’s Halloween.
This is the Halloween that never was.
The one buried under static, still whispering in the soil, humming lullabies for the deranged.
ECHØVEIL RADIO
Episode II // DOS // DEUX // TwO \\ pedi
Tune in — if you dare — and let the transmission flood your skull with ghosts.
As always, eternal thanks to my friend Séraphitüs-Séraphîta for the artwork.
And shout out to Hystalgia, one of my musical heroes. Let’s make this happen again and again !

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: ECHØVEIL RADIO VOLUME 4 – Old Moth Dreams
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
ECHØVEIL RADIO // VOLUME IV — WITH OLD MOTH DREAMS !!!!
Hello, or good evening, dear travelers of the strange and uncharted sonic underworlds.
The hour has come for the fourth transmission of ECHØVEIL RADIO, the station that unsettles well-behaved children and the ill-behaved ones too.
For this fourth episode, drenched in impossible colors fallen straight from the sky, we have the distinct honor of welcoming Old Moth Dreams as our guest. An experimental, noisy, psychedelic dungeon synth project, wildly variegated and proudly unclassifiable. Hailing from Rhode Island, Old Moth Dreams delivers a body of work that is utterly singular: free-roaming, unhinged, nightmarish, and strangely marvelous. Within its labyrinth you will catch surreal refractions of avant-progressive rock, neo-classical shadows, darkwave reveries, progressive electronics, dark ambient vapors, and doom metal gravity.
Please do check out his amazing bandcamp right here:
oldmothdreams.bandcamp.com/music
Our Rhode Island sound alchemist has curated a selection that mirrors their own mutating identity: radically diverse and joyfully unfaithful to genre borders. Expect experimental rock, old-school industrial relics, krautrock propulsion, cracked-voiced singers, satanic metal incursions, ethio-jazz detours, minimalist classical spells, and maestro Morricone at his most dungeon-synth-licious.
On my side of the altar, I bring you the usual scattered offerings: musique concrète, Indeterminacy, Latin synth-pop hallucinations, Japanese noise-psych-rock eruptions, no wave abrasion, avant-rock contortions, RIO mutations, experimental noise, Italian chanson ghosts, euphoric rap fragments, early electronic circuitry, and other playful psychédelic misbehaviors.
Final episode of 2025.
And I look forward to meeting you again in 2026, with more sumptuous and unexpected guests lurking just beyond the static.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: ECHØVEIL RADIO VOLUME 5 – Paranoised
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
ECHØVEIL RADIO // VOLUME V — WITH PARANOISED !!!!
The radio coughed. The dial bled. Episode V of ECHØVEIL Radio clawed its way out of the receiver, smelling faintly of ozone, dust, and forgotten tapes left too long in overheated cars. The experiment continued. The experiment intensified. The experiment briefly stared back at you and smiled.
This time, the transmission bent inward, collapsing into itself like a Möbius strip made of corrupted reels. Our guest apparition: Paranoised, alone with his archives, his ghosts, his innumerable parallel selves. No curation. No compromise. No outside contamination. A mixtape composed exclusively of his own personal tracks, exhumed from the deep strata of his sonic memory. Surrealist noise drifting like radioactive fog. Musique concrète warped into obscene shapes. Anti-music of the highest caliber, gnawing at structure, mocking coherence, celebrating glorious malfunction. Sound as residue. Sound as obsession. Sound as a deliberate wrong turn taken at full speed.
BTW, please investigate his Bandcamp. You’ll never be the same (and that’s not a bad thing):
paranoised.bandcamp.com/music
Meanwhile, Sir Kuliktavikt, still technically hosting but spiritually elsewhere, scattered his selections across time, geography, and reason. Italian prog-rock blooming with baroque excess. A single Renaissance gem, intact, gleaming, quietly defiant against the centuries. Minimal ambient noise stretched thin as frost. Psychedelic folk murmuring pastoral hallucinations. Hypnagogic rock-pop drifting between sleep paralysis and soft neon nostalgia. Contemporary classical exploding in over-the-top gestures, orchestral vertigo barely contained. Lo-fi Japanese blues-dirges rasping like damaged memories. African psych-jazz spiralling in heat and dust. MPB glowing with bittersweet melancholy. Ultra-weird, spectral library music creeping like background radiation. Romantic Raw Black Metal buzzing with impossible bees. Free jazz unfolding in a slow, zen-like suspension, breath and space doing the heavy lifting. And finally, a krautrock nocturne by Cluster, calm, serene, motorik reduced to a pulse barely disturbing the night air.
No genre loyalty. No safety rails. Just an ecstatic constellation of sounds, eras, intentions and beautiful mistakes.
Tune in. Get lost. Forget what radio was supposed to be.
Enjoy.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: ECHØVEIL RADIO VOLUME 6 – Saint Elisabeth
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
ECHØVEIL RADIO VI drifts in like a fever remembered by the body but not the mind. A nocturnal broadcast stitched from borrowed hours, cracked shellac dreams, scorched tape, devotional noise, jazz ghosts still sweating incense, and pop melodies that have forgotten their own faces.
Sir Kuliktavikt opens the séance with a cartography of beautiful disorientation. Ancient psych-prog hallucinations brush against raw black metal, dubwise murmurs, and musique concrète tantrums. Live Fahey fills the room with despair and joy in equal measure. Sun Ra splits the sky into twin stars while Henry Cowell claws the inside of the piano like an animal trapped in folklore. Darkthrone exhales a wind of sorrow, then Vince Guaraldi smiles briefly through the smoke, as if nothing terrible ever happened. Nihilism dances. Love songs rot tenderly. Machines rehearse joy. Folk music sleeps with ghosts. Everything bleeds into everything else, and somehow the wound sings.
This episode wanders without a map, slipping from jazz cellars to lunar temples, from minimalist mountain air to television static soaked in grief. Each track is a door left ajar. Each silence a threat. A playlist behaving like a half-remembered childhood, where cartoon melodies coexist with death, tenderness with ulcers, ecstasy with dental drills.
Then, my friend, the noise auteur Saint Elisabeth arrives to take over the airwaves. His mixtape unfolds like a reliquary smashed on concrete. Miles Davis whispers to Coltrane through walls of time. Basinski lets decay speak its true language. Burroughs mutters spells directly into the tape hiss. Alice Coltrane ascends. Ahab drags the ocean into the room. Sonic Youth trembles. Patti Smith elegizes the air itself. Saint Elisabeth’s church is built on freedom, sonic jubilation, cunning euphonious devastation, and copious amounts of FUNK-KOSMIGROOVE (oh yes) and experimental avant-noise.
Tune in and hear radio as it should be broadcast.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: echostrial noisoveil
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
With echostrial noisoveil, RDKPL descends into a fractured industrial dreamspace where sound behaves like unstable matter. Across three dense compositions, abstract glitch eruptions, corroded noise strata and musique concrète debris grind against each other in slow, deliberate tension. Percussive shapes emerge and collapse like malfunctioning machinery heard through fog, while deconstructed electronics stutter, scrape and pulse with a strange, almost ritual insistence.
Nothing here seeks resolution or comfort. Instead, echostrial noisoveil unfolds as a series of sonic experiments conducted in darkness, where echoes multiply, rhythms rot, and textures reveal hidden architectures beneath their surface violence. It is harsh yet precise, oppressive yet deeply absorbing: a work that rewards attentive listening, inviting the listener to wander inside its broken mechanisms and ghostly reverberations.
A stark and fascinating release, echostrial noisoveil stands as one of RDKPL’s most compelling explorations of abstract industrial noise, perfectly aligned with ECHØVEIL’s fascination for sound as shadow, residue, and altered perception.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Ethereal K-Pop Noise
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Ethereal K-Pop Noise by Buenos Aires sound-alchemist pinkhydrangea arrives like a clandestine meteor of sweetness and distortion, a strange blossom blooming inside your ribcage. Few records this year have radiated such dangerous beauty. Each track pulls you beneath successive tides of shimmering rose-vermilion ecstasy, torrents of glittering night-juice that flare and flare and flare again inside the sibylline dark. It feels like being carried by tornados of glass-dust splendor: they trace the spine with tenderness while carving luminous faultlines across the skin.
Enchanting K-Pop vapor rises through vertiginous noise-ambient cyclones, forming a union so improbable it should collapse under its own delirium, yet instead it sings, perfectly. Violent Dream Pop. Though the violence is the benevolent kind, the sort that leaves your face bloodied but your heart hammering in euphoric devotion. Like falling off your skateboard while on shrooms, breaking all the bones in your body while the SUN BLOOMS INTO SUPERNOVA above you. Stars collide. Candied-psych-lychee-kawaii-knife-oolong storms whirl around your thoughts. Bliss with fangs.
A sonic budae jjigae for the soul: molten, spicy, comforting, deranged, alive.
A record that hurts in precisely the way you needed. A record that heals by breaking you open.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Flutterings in Abyss
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
It begins in the filled void.
Not emptiness. Saturation. A thickness that growls, twists, sweats. Cosmic Fumes opens the wound again, but deeper this time. The ground has collapsed into a vast scar-lake, slow-boiling at the edge of a burned forest that still exhales its last heat. Nothing moves, yet everything churns.
Bodies remain. Half-charred, half-warped, slipping into the black slurry. Ash-mud. Post-human sediment. They do not disappear. They soften. They merge. The lake absorbs without urgency.
The sound holds.
A minimal mass, nearly static, but internally restless. Low frequencies knead themselves. Small ruptures form and reseal. Orientation dissolves. There is no outside, no perimeter, only this trembling density. From within it, something vocal emerges. Not language. Not quite sound. A thin, distant keening. The void, learning how to call.
It pulls.
Softly. Constantly. It whispers in mud, in rot, in slow suction. The world has become a burned wound that will not close. Cosmic Fumes stretches this state to its limit, until even terror stabilizes, until fear itself becomes calm, stripped, declarative. A final utterance, bare and resigned.
Then nothing changes.
But everything has shifted.
UgUrGkuliktavikt does not enter. It condenses.
A fog settles over the same scene, thick, particulate, almost granular. Atomic dust falls without weight, coating the lake, the bodies, the skeletal remains of the forest. Time has passed, or failed to pass. Growth appears, but incorrectly. Pale, diseased sprouts push through the fouled ground, hesitant, already decaying.
Above, no sun. No moon.
A sphere.
Not luminous. Not dark. A pressure suspended in the sky. A closed system of suffering, radiating without light. A sun of exhaustion. Hope extinguished long before it could be named.
Figures gather.
Humanoid only by approximation. Hooded, bent, incomplete. Anti-priests orbit the lake, drawn to it without understanding. They kneel before stones, before water, before fragments of bone. Their gestures are devotional but broken. Hands brushing the soil. Fingers tracing nothing. Mouths leaking murmurs that never assemble into meaning.
They plead, but not for salvation.
For continuation.
Their voices slip into wet laughter, into choking hymns, into low, animal repetitions. The lake answers with small movements. Surface tension shivers. Shapes suggest themselves beneath. Not emergence. Not presence. Just pressure, waiting.
UgUrGkuliktavikt does not corrupt the landscape.
It confirms it.
The void is no longer a process. No longer an event. It is fixed. Absolute. The end not as conclusion, but as condition. No before. No after. Only this: a stagnant infinity, where decay has completed itself and continues anyway.
The fluttering persists.
Not life. Not death.
A residual trembling in the abyss, where something once tried to exist and failed without ever stopping.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: four strains
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
four variations on a theme of malice.
Improvised and overdubbed synths recorded to tape during the last week of November at the Grey Haven, Bendalong.
-Gogol
---
Four tracks. Four slow infections. Each one improvised in near-darkness, with flaws deliberately left to fester. Nothing here is polished or corrected. The hiss remains. The wobble persists. The atmosphere is allowed to rot naturally.
The tools were modest and worn. A second-hand Roland Boutique SH-01A, freshly acquired and still unfamiliar in the hands. A delay unit smearing time into itself. A loop pedal gnawing at fragments. A four-track tape recorder quietly bleeding its ghosts into the signal. These machines were set loose inside a small, isolated house buried in the bush on the south coast of New South Wales.
That week, the land was hostile. Cold rain. Grey skies that never fully lifted. The bush no longer felt neutral. It loomed. It watched. Gogol treated the forest not as scenery, but as a mirror. A place where the malice embedded in human history seeps back into soil and bark. Colonisation. Erasure. Genocide. These thoughts are impossible to silence when walking through Australian bushland. The land remembers, even when the present pretends not to.
Each track unfolds like a cautious walk between trees that know more than they should. Sounds creep rather than advance. Melodies form before collapsing back into shadow. The past leaks through every sustained note, heavy and unresolved.
The night is cold. The rain does not absolve anything. The elements keep their records.
Minimalist, hushed, and deeply malignant, four strains is a small but devastating document of quiet menace.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 30, 2026

iamgogol.bandcamp.com

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Guarnições
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Field recordings captured in Rio de Janeiro between February 11–24, 2025. Composed from sounds recorded across the city, with kalimba and caxixi (the only two instruments that I bought in Rio). Edited and produced exclusively on a Roland SP-404MKII.
-Yienksa
---
Rio de Janeiro, February 11–24, 2025.
Fragments lifted, not taken. Air, dust, passing currents.
Voices speaking, chanting, unfastened from their mouths.
They warp, fold, return as something thinner than breath. Aether, or its residue.
Kalimba. Caxixi.
Small constellations trembling in the light. Sparse, deliberate, almost secret.
Everything else: the city, half-erased, still pulsing beneath the surface.
A living, breathing organism of sound, already forgetting its own shape.
Memories disintegrating into dreams.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Gyotaku II
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
*Gyotaku is a Japanese art form that involves reproducing fish impressions on various surfaces, such as paper or fabric.
---
Maquereau Dose resurfaces after its first surreal, abrasive sonic misdeed, still trailing psychotropic fumes and scorched echoes. With Gyotaku II, the Montreal-based duo deepens the incision. What emerges is a jubilant, syncopated collision of obsessions: guitar drone stretched into ceremonial lengths, contemporary music swollen into something ancestral and ritual-bound, fuzz-soaked proto–noise rock, lunar and half-spoiled proto-ambient, dada loosened at the seams, free-improv post-rock with the brakes cut and the wheel still spinning.
Everything feels deliciously misaligned. Vast yet hidden. A secret whispered directly into the inner ear by a fog-born entity, indulgent and unclean, some impious god drifting through vaporous Amethyst seas. The music breathes like a slow tide, eroding structure, polishing dissonance into something strangely tender.
Listening feels like eavesdropping on an interstellar jam where the Taj Mahal Travellers tune their ghosts alongside Barrett-era Pink Floyd, Les Rallizes Dénudés, early Sonic Youth, Yellow Swans, Birchville Cat Motel, Loren Mazzacane Connors, and Fushitsusha. Not imitation, but shared gravity. A gathering point where sound forgets its century and remembers something older.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Hospice
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Hospice : Noun
1 : an inn for travelers
especially : one kept by a religious order
2 : a place or program for caring for dying persons
“Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted”
Matthew 5 : 4
These are sounds that I cannot quite explain, except that I was compelled to create them. Vague memories, flashes. Abstractions. Dedicated to those who mourn. Love.
* There is no Track I
This is a bit of a departure for Saint Elisabeth, and I hope you’ll take the time to listen to the piece as a whole. Hospice was very much intended to be one long sound. Thank you all for your support, it carries me.
-Saint Elisabeth
---
Hospice by sound artist Saint-Elisabeth is a work reduced to the marrow. Beautiful and minimal, noisy yet ambient, it breathes with a fragile, restrained gravity. This release marks the second issue in ECHØVEIL’s series devoted to the back catalogue of Saint-Elisabeth, which I strongly encourage you to explore in full. It is all essential, all deeply worthwhile:
saintelisabeth.bandcamp.com
What remains here is stripped of aggression, stripped of nightmare. Only residual dust from dark ambient traditions lingers, eroded until compassion becomes the dominant frequency. Ancient, unresolved regret drifts through these pieces like incense in an abandoned chapel. The music feels suspended between states, hovering in an uncertain corridor between the world of the living and the world of the dying, unsure of where the soul might finally come to rest.
Hospice unfolds as a space of supreme recollection and quiet mourning. Blurred memories surface and dissolve, melancholy is sublimated into texture, and silence itself becomes an active presence. The atmosphere is solemn and fascinating, grief-stricken yet strangely tender, always held in suspension. It is beautiful, tragic, and deeply humane. A work of rare restraint and profound emotional ambiguity.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Houses Of The Damned
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
The house stood there, menacing with its long, dark shadows deeply cast, tragic history lining its inhuman face. How many sorrowful lives had it claimed in its long life? How many poor souls forever lost inside its bloodstained and tear soaked walls, trapped now, forever tenants haunting its unhallowed halls?
"Lots of books have been written about houses of the damned. The bagheria villa of monsters, near palermo, the house of peacocks in Brussels, the Salamander Maison in France. " - E. Varelli
"The house did not shelter. It devoured. " - Malachai Blackthorn
"These structures were built with the assistance of black magic, and thus they remain as haunted dwellings until the end of time". - E.Varelli
---
Rags Ov Light returns to ECHØVEIL RECORDS with Houses of the Damned, a brief yet bottomless descent into the trembling half-world where dust remembers what the living have forgotten.
Three spectral invocations, three atmospheric dungeon-synth lamentations drifting at the threshold of noctambulant ambient — each one a candle guttering in a corridor that barely exists.
These are hymns for the ruined houses: collapsed porches and sighing attics, soaked walls eroding grain by grain under the endless rain. Within them wander the weary spirits, exhausted by centuries of pleading, still murmuring their broken questions into the fog. Their despair curls like incense through the air, yet Rags Ov Light shapes it into something strangely warm, strangely cold — a paradoxical glow in the mausoleum of abandonment.
Minimalist keyboards trace the contours of forgotten rooms, of staircases that dream of ascent, of foundations gnawed by mold and memory. Through these tones, we are invited to inhabit the eyes of the withered and the sorrow-stricken — the ones who linger at the edge of unreality, unsure of why they stayed, unsure of where the door ever was.
Houses of the Damned is a miniature requiem for all structures that outlived their tenants, a fragile shard of hope buried inside centuries of melancholic drift.
A sublime short album from one of the most haunting visionaries working in the realm today.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Husk
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
the body as cathedral of rot.
a whispering ruin in pink meat.
once tender, now translucent.
bones murmur,
ligaments hum in lowercase agony —
a hymn for the collapsing anatomy of god.
this album is not music.
it is a posthumous diary written by your organs,
one note at a time,
while the nervous system gurgles its requiem.
in Husk the skin remembers what it used to hold,
and the sound remembers what silence took.
you will hear:
cartilage dreaming of elasticity,
cells abandoning the clock,
the exhale of a saint dissolved in morphine,
the ghost of a shoulder still carrying its phantom.
Séraphitüs-Séraphîta writes from inside the decomposition —
not metaphorical, but actual,
a descent where the flesh forgets its coordinates
and begins to speak in interference,
in shrill electronic prayers,
in the unmusical rhythm of fatigue.
each track is a medical document rewritten by a fever,
each drone a biopsy of despair.
the body does not sing;
it leaks sound like a wound that refuses theology.
between the ruptures,
gratitude flickers like a dying pulse —
a tenderness so faint
it could be mistaken for static.
there are no endings here,
only the long,
viscous hush
of something once called human,
still vibrating
in its own absence.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Hymnsofbloodyghostlynightintheshadowsofthesickdeathreaperofblacknessandchaos
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Darkness devours the flesh of the intrinsic,
gnawing at the base-code of being,
while the intestines of reality spill and steam across a trembling plane of half-existence—
blood-smoke rising, organ-vapor spiraling upward like aborted prayers,
sulphur ghosts twisting in the air,
and the sobbing of hymns that forgot their own theology.
A schizophrenic painter-deity tears open his canvases of flayed human skin,
torquing dimensions until they scream,
wringing them like wet universes until a vermilion, rancid ichor pours out—
the hemorrhage of dying timelines collapsing against one another.
He ruptures his own eyes with a dagger sculpted from interstellar mist,
drinks the aqueous humor like a sacrament of confusion,
and laughs—
a glitching, multi-voiced cackle echoing through a thousand parallel skulls.
Smoke-hyenas descend from ruptured nebulae,
carrion constellations shifting into fang and maw,
shadows devouring the open mouth,
the mouth devouring the shadow,
the universe flickering in and out like a schizophrenic heartbeat.
Post-human slurry, dissolution-digestion—
the cosmos retches streaks of blackened residue,
the decayed sediment of mutilated corporeal forms
dissolving into an obscene, starless night that gorges on its own horizon.
In that wet, sweating barn—
a barn that exists simultaneously in thirteen contradictory realities—
woodlice seep from a gaping orifice torn in the trembling, humid ground.
They squeal in frequencies that peel skin.
They coo in tones that deform memory.
They rut in an orgy of mucosal sound,
multiplying until individuality rots away,
merging into a single abomination of cold soot and collapsed identity,
a creature dreaming in wavelengths that should not exist.
The new times have arrived.
The sky will be cleaved by the scepter of cosmic filth,
the gutter-born crown of the deranged and the infinite,
and nothing—
not even the ghost of nothing—
will ever
be anything
again.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Hypoxia
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
air ≠ breath ≠ time
fifty minutes fifty minutes fifty minutes
three carcasses of sound tied together by the black saliva of nothingness
there is no “music” here, only afterbirth
recorded in the lungs of a dying god, deep inside a rusted ventilator that forgot what air feels like.
IT CONSUMES
every hiss = a dying sun vomiting memories.
every hum = a worm gnawing on dead electricity.
Between the first and the third
lies a wound
a drone the size of a dead planet
crawling with insect deities, faceless and sacred in their starvation
they burrow through the rot of nonexistent worlds,
worlds that never existed yet still decayed
rotted perfectly, beautifully, into conceptual ruin.
ERRANT STATIC has done it.
the sound of not existing.
the music of nothing that ever was.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
