ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: I am the invisible fire that works in secret
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Charred flesh corridors collapsed around my stripped carcass.
Visions from a forbidden elsewhere filled the inside of my sight.
Eyes.
Everywhere.
On my face, my brow, my chest, my legs.
Breeding. Watching. Sick with reason undone.
The corridors died.
An echo remained.
A city that was always abandoned.
Houses confessed by screaming obsolete prayers.
Windows became cleavers, vomiting grey, rancid meat.
The streets were split open by something older than memory.
From the cracks came black light. Croaking corpses.
And something else.
Unexplainable. It moves.
I wept coal from every opening in my body.
Dead night coupled with spoiled day.
They tore each other open. Fed. Bled.
They made a permanent dusk, red, crawling.
The sky refused its own color.
Buildings rotted under purple disease.
Inside: rituals without language.
Anti-beings inviting ancient, malicious gods
to wear them from the inside.
Everything is rusted flesh.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Idle Hand
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Sometimes, life quietly places an album in your hands that knocks the breath out of you. One you do not merely enjoy, but fall headfirst into. In love with its singular atmosphere, its deceptively simple yet finely wrought compositions, its intimate and enchanted inner world. Idle Hand is very much one of those rare encounters.
As a first full statement, this debut from Tucson, Arizona based experimental and cinematic dungeon and nature synth project FERAL CLAW feels almost unreal in its level of confidence and vision. It is the kind of arrival that suggests a path already mapped in secret, and hints at even stranger and more arresting territories ahead. This is a project to watch closely.
FERAL CLAW weaves together classic dungeon synth, nature synth and fantasy synth with an almost uncanny ease, folding in field recordings and naturalistic samples that feel organic rather than ornamental. Nocturnal synthwave hues drift through the fog, introspective spoken word passages surface like half remembered thoughts, while ambient, dark ambient and analog horror textures seep into the cracks. A faint, surreal vaporwave shimmer lingers at the edges, just enough to warp the perspective.
Each track exists as its own fragile and flourishing microcosm. Small worlds, carefully assembled, brimming with quiet wonder and melancholy. You wander through them willingly, gradually hypnotized by the creator’s gift for carving minimalist melodies that linger long after the sound has faded, emotional without excess, intimate without fragility.
And then there is the final piece. Nearly twenty minutes long, it unfolds as a truly staggering sonic voyage. A place where getting lost feels like the entire point. Chimera like, nocturnal, dream soaked and hypnagogic, it evokes a kind of faded cinematic New Age. Darker, stranger, more suggestive. At moments, it even recalls the most atmospheric and haunted corners of Boards of Canada. A small masterpiece in itself, one that reveals its full depth when experienced alongside the beautiful accompanying story.
This is an album to inhabit, not simply to hear.
You are strongly encouraged to read the accompanying narrative while listening:
feralclaw.com/a-spectral-guide/f/a-spectral-guide
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 8, 2026
Feral Claw was birthed from a dream in the heart of the Sonoran Desert.
Originally released on July 23, 2025.
Recorded, mixed and mastered at Hanner House Records, Tucson, Arizona.
feralclaw.bandcamp.com

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: IV
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
now like sleep collapsing into static—
the soft hiss between thoughts—
the TV’s ghost channel hums something half-remembered,
a wordless weather of fatigue.
white on white on white—
the sky buffering,
the mind lagging—
pixels of yesterday dissolving into soft blizzards of dust-memory.
procrastination drips, viscous, from the ceiling of time.
i try to move but my limbs are delayed transmissions,
feedback loops of maybe-later, maybe-never.
somewhere far, a voice made of snowblind vowels murmurs
wake up or go back to sleep—
i can’t tell which channel it’s on.
the soul is greyscale,
stretched thin over the endless hum,
an old tape played until the oxide flakes off.
nothing remains but the sigh of a dying frequency,
a shimmer of almost-recognition,
dissolving into the infinite nap of light.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released November 14, 2025
Exsomnus : the key has fallen through the sky (yet... there never was any key)

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: IX
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
The ninth wound. The ninth transmission. The machine mutters and folds into itself — sparks dripping like black honey. Paranoised digs into the nerve of the thing, that zone where electricity dreams of bone. Somewhere between a corpse-painted Delia Derbyshire humming in the dark and Les Légions Noires conducting séances through tape recorders.
A KPM library record from a reality too warped to exist, playing on a melted turntable orbiting a dead planet. Varèse reassembled from rust and plasma, reborn as Tetsuo’s final spasmodic form under the cracked hand of a deranged Tesla, his assistant Ligotti feeding static into the wound.
IX sounds like a Game Boy haunted by multiple entities, like the ghost of sound trying to find a shape — all feedback, chrome, pulse, collapse. A place where UFOs dissolve into their own signal, and the night eats the night again.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released November 9, 2025

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: KommandOOverdose & I,Eternal
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
We share our culture when we share sounds. We work together. And you?
-KommandOOverdose & I,Eternal
---
This album is a fall that never learns.
A transatlantic collision between KommandOOverdose (Québec) and I, Eternal (France), two severely damaged sound architects stitching their respective insanities into a single unstable mass. What unfolds is not a collaboration but a shared delirium, a mutual infection engineered for listeners who crave vertigo, abrasion, and the pleasure of being dismantled.
Listening feels like standing atop a hallucinated mountain, toes curling over the edge. You fall. You land somewhere worse. The ground is oily and pulsating, beating like an electric heart. Above, an ash-choked sky. Around you, passing spectres with syringe-arms knitting top hats from human flesh, their eye sockets empty because the eyes are elsewhere. Hundreds of them. Floating. Watching. Inspecting. Dissecting. Some melt like Dalí clocks. Others collapse inward, becoming screaming black holes.
Impossible sounds drip into carbonized matter. Spoiled starlight flows upward in a reversed cascade. Another fall. And another. Each impact fractures you further, and somehow your face splits into a grotesque grin, taped together, skin cracked, torn, cheekbones exposed to the air. The sky turns psychedelic fuchsia. Bats descend to gnaw at you, rattling extraterrestrial noisemakers with their wings.
Exquisite corpses, taken literally. Cadavers dipped in hollandaise sauce. Fingers especially crispy.
You wander deeper into an ever-thickening sonic vapor. Electrical wires perform a danse macabre, coiling lovingly around your decomposing shell, moaning with pleasure. Another fall. A damp dungeon. One light only. A single electric globe glued to the ceiling. Blood seeps inside it. No exit. Just tiny holes in the walls. From one hole, an ear drops, still twitching. Then the spiders come. From all the holes. Thousands. Millions.
The globe laughs and explodes in a spray of blood.
Spiders cover your skin. You bleed. You laugh. They crawl into your eyes.
Your eyes.
Yours ; yes.
YOUR EYES.
This record does not want to be understood. It wants to keep falling with you.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 10, 2026
KommandOOverdose & I,Eternal: delicious sounds
kommandooverdose1.bandcamp.com
ieternal1.bandcamp.com

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Lacridronesa | A Requiem Drone Mass, Vol. I
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Lacridronesa is a Requiem Drone Mass (a drone composition for the dead). Deconstructed classical samples unravel and form ambient noise walls that maintain the sorrowful, mournful character of their provenance. If you listen closely enough, you might catch choral fragments of the original samples breaking through.
Volume I includes a wintery, dark ambient selection of four movements honoring the life and work of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, released on the 234th anniversary of his death.
-Séraphitüs-Séraphîta
═══════════════════════════════════════
Requiem æternam dona eis, Dómine.
Et lux perpétua lúceat eis.
Fidélium ánimæ, per misericórdiam Dei, requiéscant in pace.
Amen.
═══════════════════════════════════════
Lacridronesa is the latest funereal offering from the multidisciplinary visionary Séraphitüs-Séraphîta—a Requiem-Mass transmuted into drone, into wounded resonance, into a trembling procession of tones wandering through unnameable fogs and the brittle oubliettes of the centuries.
Here, the wind itself becomes cantor: carrying its regrets across extinct fields, scattering the dried, death-tinged sobs of time—time, that pitiless weight grinding all memory into pale dust. Across these four inconsolable drone-laments, beauty persists like an eternal solitude: hypnotic, bent under the invisible burden of vanished days, spiralling through a night that twists upon a sky rusted with old bitterness.
Memory, regret, joy, sorrow, triumph, defeat—everything unthreads itself with slow majesty. Everything dislocates in a perpetual waltz of the dead, beneath the ancient ashen vapors of a millennial mist. All returns to dust, to origins. Even the most sumptuous classical works become shards of forgetting in the cemetery of our drifting lives—common graves of impossible glass.
Lacridronesa is a meditation on dissolution, a vigil held in the ruins of remembrance. A work where every resonance feels anointed with the cold incense of destiny, as though we were all gently chloroformed by the stigmata of our own becoming.
A requiem for the things we loved, for the things we lost, for the things we could never name.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Le Marécage aux Secrets Hermétiques
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
"Le Marécage aux Secrets Hermétiques" is the new offering from UgUrGkuliktavikt — an exploration of what “new age” music might become once filtered through a haunted mind, where healing tones are veined with shadows, and harsh noise lurks just beneath the moss.
This swamp is neither comforting nor threatening: it pulses with an ancient ambivalence, a haze of hesitant fog and deceptive paths. You move through it as though wandering inside a dream unsure whether it wants to soothe you or swallow you whole.
Through the drifting vapors, electric faeries flicker, strange creatures shift their weight in the mud, and their distant, warped cries weave a crooked liturgy.
It is an imaginary ecosystem where nature breathes sideways, where sound mutates in the mist, where gentleness and dread dissolve into one another.
A spectral new age, muddied and shimmering, guided by a trembling inner light.
Welcome to the swamp.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Les hilarants halls du Château UGZykBriJjvNaukorG
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
"Les hilarants halls du Château UGZykBriJjvNaukorG" is a document that should not exist in this form.
A rework, yes, but also a spatial anomaly.
Rooms repeat without symmetry. Hallways elongate mid-listening. Laughter collapses into pressure, then into absence. Sound behaves like an infected document: footnotes that whisper, margins that breathe, frequencies that relocate when not observed.
I,Eternal did not rework the album so much as submit it to non-Euclidean protocols, splicing its corpus through hypnagogic machinery and forbidden archival noise. What emerges is a ghost architecture, assembled from drone, residue, and mnemonic corrosion.
These are sick soundscapes ; this is decadent and ghoulish doom-ambient.
The halls are still laughing. They are hungrier than before. And now, they see through you.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 12, 2026
Sir Kuliktavikt: conjurer of endless noises and unnameable others; diseased keyboards that vomit convulsions and writhing echoes; nightmares woven into the seams of decayed harmonies; desecrator of what was once beautiful music, now rendered profane and splintered; chronicler of ruin; end of report.
I,Eternal: senior operator of forbidden apparatus and unlicensed sonic experiments; executor of controlled contamination protocols; handler of unstable frequencies and bioacoustic residues; injector of hypnagogic agents into corrupted signal chains; engineer of sleep-deprivation chambers and psychic feedback loops

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Life In A Coffin
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Raw black metal, feral and incandescent with a sickly glow. It exults while it crushes. A celestial rot spreads through worlds and anti-worlds alike, flaking into dark ambient dust, entangled with dungeon synth carcasses and corroded metallic residue.
Everything trembles in lo-fi grandeur. Tape hiss like dying lungs. Unfathomable chasms opening beneath skeletal melodies. A dream gasps its last breath and collapses inward, birthing the nightmare directly inside the abyss. Cold vertigo. Furious contemplation.
The vocals are not sung but exhumed. Lysergic echoes tearing through burial soil. Keyboards spill schizophrenic torrents across a surreal wasteland where nothing lives, yet everything persists in decomposition.
It is brief. It leaves wounds that itch.
And still, something inside begs to return. Again. Again.
Our emptied souls wander willingly into this supernatural cosmogony, circling the coffin, listening for movement within.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released February 24, 2026

Three vertiginous, mind-twisting tracks of raw, lo-fi, yet exquisitely layered atmospheric black metal — experimental, surreal, motif-driven, euphoric, overwhelming—plus a brief, heart-wrenchingly beautiful acoustic folk interlude…

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Manitou
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A journey back into an earlier, demented artefact from the vast and uncompromising discography of the Canadian sound sorcerer Phibes Praetorius.
Here, the occult sonic alchemist turns his attention to the myth of the Wendigo: a malevolent spirit of Algonquian folklore, a skeletal giant with a heart of ice, embodiment of hunger, greed, and cannibalism. Associated with winter, famine, and the decay of the human soul, it possesses or transforms humans who have tasted human flesh, turning them into ravenous monsters. A warning woven into the marrow of morality, explored across literature and dark popular imagination.
Through disoriented, labyrinthine tracks, Phibes Praetorius drags the listener across frozen landscapes corrupted by malevolent spirits, coaxing the human mind to indulge its basest instincts. Dark ambient pulses shiver like frostbitten veins; haunted plunderphonics unravel like spectral tape loops; ritualistic deliriums smolder hypnotically, corrosively; documentary fragments and cryptic film samples twist into fractured visions; concrete music splinters into schizophrenic false paths—all coalescing under the clawed hands of a masterful, ruthless sonic manipulator, always lurking where least expected.
This is horror. This is ritual. This is exquisite, experimental sonic art.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Moments of Presentiment
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Tape sounds inspired by dilapidated churches, the midwest, isolated religious communities, loons, the 1970’s, solo organ performances of hymnals and the color green.
---
Under the name Seinnid, Maine-based sound artist Jake Smith offers a profoundly haunted work of tape music, a small obtuse miracle, humble and strangely devastating. This is music that seems to arrive already aged, already eroded, as if unearthed rather than composed. Echoes of The Caretaker, William Basinski or Fennesz drift through its corridors, not as references but as distant relatives, silhouettes glimpsed through fogged glass.
Faded religious hymns hover like half-forgotten prayers. Yellowed polaroids tremble in the air, their subjects dissolving as you try to recognize them. Ambient organ tones are kneaded and stretched until they buckle under their own weight, collapsing beautifully, reverently. Ballroom jazz ghosts stagger and melt, once-crowded rooms turning into approximate ambient swamps, warped and tender. Everything here feels suspended between grace and decay, between memory and the slow erasure of being itself.
This is not nostalgia as comfort, but nostalgia as vertigo. A record that listens to itself disappearing. A record that haunts you as you haunt yourself.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 11, 2026

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: More strings and grasshoppers
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
abandoned keys / insect choirs /
the city sleeps, but the piano still breathes through the dust.
its veins are cracked ivory, its lungs full of wind and asphalt.
a cyclist passes — metallic heartbeat.
a hammer falls — inside the dream of a construction site.
grasshoppers click their coded hymns,
communicating with frequencies the human ear refuses to name.
thirty-seven fragments, each one a broken syllable from the same haunted mouth.
the piano doesn’t play music anymore — it performs autopsies of silence.
it mutters in percussive tongues,
it coughs in feedback,
it scratches itself against the thin membrane between now and before.
these are songs for a world where instruments remember being trees,
where strings vibrate like radio wires under the skin of a fevered sky,
where each sound is both bone and echo, both ritual and malfunction.
if Forks, Strings and Birds was the gentle implosion of melody,
then More Strings and Grasshoppers is the fever after the implosion —
a delirium of rhythm,
a swarm of microscopic dances,
a trance for the rusted gods of Montreal’s roadside ruins.
the hammer hits, the air trembles.
no one conducts.
the piano convulses, and the world listens through its cracks.
[the echo remains.]
[the grasshoppers keep time.]
[the city dissolves into the reverb.]
↯ ↯ ↯
sound returns as dust.
and dust remembers as it dissolves.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released January 11, 2026
All tracks were recorded on an abandoned piano found by the roadside in Montreal. Grasshoppers, cyclists, and construction noises were captured at the same time. This EP is an unplanned follow-up to Forks, strings and birds, born from another encounter with a forgotten piano.
musiquemoleculaire.bandcamp.com/album/forks-strings-and-birds
One piece from this album was broadcast on the New Music Show on BBC Radio 3. I appreciated the announcer’s delivery when describing the album, so I included a brief excerpt as an introduction. The text remains the property of its original author and broadcaster.'
-Yienksa
---

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: nest
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Nest is an illusion of shelter.
A womb of plush, psychedelic textures. Soft. Enveloping. Almost kind.
You lie curled inside it, pressed against walls made of confused noise and swollen dreams. Sounds breathe. Pulse. Repeat. Hypnotic, obsessive, pharamineous. A cocoon dream. A refuge stitched from warmth and disorientation.
Too late, you understand.
It is not a nest.
It is a web.
The spider arrives with ceremonial patience. Vast beyond proportion. Eyes cold and cosmic, reflecting geometries that should not exist. Hairy legs slick with hemlock, brushing gently as they close in. A crystalline body, surreal, faceted, bent at impossible angles. A visitor from elsewhere. From flaccid, unreasoning dimensions.
The dream curdles.
Everything turns red.
Red-black-red-crimson.
Thoughts collide and rupture, invaded by hallucinogenic venom. Time softens. Identity frays. As the body is devoured, slowly, tenderly, an obscene ecstasy blooms. Bones crushed. Blood flowing with syrupy calm. A smile frozen at the corner of the mouth. Mandibles tearing cheeks with surgical devotion.
And beneath the horror, a secret peace.
The soul loosens its grip. It evaporates like water becoming vapor. Dissolving. Feeding the web. Feeding the thing. Feeding the chaos.
To be consumed is to belong.
To belong is to disappear.
To disappear is to become the chaos itself.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Three hours of dark ambient drone devoted to three fragrant flowers that bloom at night: Sweet Alyssum (Lobularia maritima), Evening Primrose (Oenothera), & Moonflower (Ipomoea alba). A gentle unraveling beneath the moon... Layered and lightly noisy with resonance.
Things start loud and dense on [𝐚𝐥𝐲𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐦 𝐈-𝐈𝐈] and begin to subtly lift on [𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐦𝐫𝐨𝐬𝐞 𝐈-𝐈𝐈]. They're then followed by a softening, quieting, and an airier energy in the second half with the 𝐦𝐨𝐨𝐧𝐟𝐥𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫 selections — some of which even feel "spacy," i.e., [𝐦𝐨𝐨𝐧𝐟𝐥𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫 𝐈𝐈𝐈-𝐈𝐕]. And by the time we arrive at [𝐦𝐨𝐨𝐧𝐟𝐥𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫 𝐕], it feels as though we've returned home... somewhere... 𓇢𓆸
-Séraphitüs-Séraphîta

NIGHTBLOOM is a lunar herbarium, a hallucinated botany. A place where hours dissolve into fragrance, where sound opens its petals only once, and only in the dark.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Nosferatu
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
WinDGeisT, O Prophet of Vibrations Forgotten, who mumbles in cathedrals carved from silence, finally arrives on ECHØVEIL !
This is the expanded edition of the EP originally released on All Hallows’ Eve by the experimental dungeon synth artist emerging from Germany’s lightless forests.
Three tracks of vampiric, ultra-atmospheric, surreal, nightmarish dungeon synth, infected throughout by black ambient seepage, as is customary for this somber lord of funereal echoes. These pieces exhume and reanimate the spectral afterimages of Murnau’s expressionist masterpiece, filtered through the forsaken inner visions of one of dungeon synth’s most singular and gifted soundscapers.
As a terminal appendix comes a remix, or rather a hostile reconfiguration: an ambient plunderphonics, dark ambient obliteration of the original material, reassembled into a single nineteen-minute trance by the known audio saboteur UgUrGkuliktavikt. Augmented with cries, ruptured screams, noise accretions, diseased keyboards, funeral piano, and stray sonic residues, the piece drags the album through a prolonged death-throes ritual.
Imagine Nosferatu unfolding inside Silent Hill, projected onto rotting walls, the film screaming back at the fog.
HEADPHONES RECOMMENDED FOR FULL IMMERSION.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Of Darkness
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
An hour of droning, liminally themed dark ambient for when one wishes to fade into the deep and cease to exist for a time.
-Errant Static
---
Of Darkness is the third work by the Utah-based noise alchemist Errant Static to surface through the cracked concrete floors of ECHØVEIL RECORDS. This time, the descent reaches backward, unearthing one of her early and most merciless artifacts, a piece that still exhales soot and old dread when disturbed.
This album is an ebony reliquary. A guided visit through the collapsed corridors of a long-abandoned subterranean mine, its supports eaten by time, its air thick with mineral ghosts and exhausted screams. It is also an extended stay in the basement of a dying asylum, where the walls are smeared with dried blood and a spongy, infectious madness that never quite hardened, never quite left.
What unfolds is a slow procession through a blackness more absolute than absence itself. Drone coils and settles like a dormant beast, dark ambient hums and crackles, purring beneath strata upon strata of morbid, serpentine noise. The sound does not rush. It stalks. It seeps. It stains.
This is a work of soot, black laid upon black, until form becomes memory and memory becomes pressure. Somewhere, a single trembling light tries to persist, flickering weakly, already aware of its own extinction.
Of Darkness does not offer catharsis. It offers solitude. A sealed environment where sound replaces walls and time dissolves into a viscous fog. The question is not whether you will find your way out, but whether you dare to remain, irreversibly alone, in these zones of sonic perdition, listening as the darkness slowly learns your name.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Overday
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Somewhere between the last syllable and the drowning of the word itself, the ship kept sinking in reverse. A slow, blissful cataclysm — guitars like glass arteries bleeding vowels into black water. Time burns, not forward but inward. post-rock, post-breath, post-body. The sound forgets itself. A requiem for the concept of remembering.
Everything is melting but so still, so immaculately still — the perfect entropy of saudade. A volcano dreaming of being a snowflake. A child’s laughter in a melted transistor, whispering coordinates of extinct emotions. frozen harmonica seep through the crust, gasping vowels that no longer exist. The sea hums in lowercase.
Dark-light, light-dark. both eyes closed. the music looks back.
Each note a collapsing sunbeam, licking the skin of the abyss. Bliss becomes static. Static becomes prayer.
This is a shipwreck remembering its own birth.
Overday — the word after dawn, before meaning.
A sonic fossil of a night that never ended — that December night, when the sky turned orange and the railroad lifted, evaporated, whispered: we’re still here, under the voltage of time.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
-----
"Overday" substitutes the standard antique piano of "the microphone is 3 electric guitars" for a more exotic "air piano" - also known as an old beat up accordion from the era when flights were divided into smoking and non-smoking - held together using a careful amalgamation of chopsticks, paperclips, and glue. Overday also includes some very low quality harmonica samples played by children, followed by said children laughing, screaming, crying, and something in-between and all-together for good measure.
-the microphone is 3 electric guitars

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: plech recøveil
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Hymns extruded from a throat lined with rust. They arrive already decomposing, already slipping, each segment separated by microscopic wounds that leak duration instead of blood. Between them: pressure. Between them: a dizziness that chews through altitude, through bone.
You enter a grocery structure that recognizes you before you exist. Its walls pulse like opened musculature stretched over scaffolding. Refrigerated infinities hum behind veils of tendon. You point at something. It unwraps itself. It is meat, but it remembers language. It trembles in your hands, whispering frequencies that have no air to travel through.
Clocks are not measured here, they are cooked. Dial-faces blister over beds of incandescent thistle, barbed wire tightening like thought loops around their circumference. Time screams in thin metallic threads, then caramelizes into a black syrup that stains everything it never touched.
This second transmission from RDKPL for ECHØVEIL RECORDS is a factory that learned how to hunger. Conveyor belts drag fragments of cracked cartilage, bent screws, sheets of metal that still think they are sky. Electricity misfires in animal patterns. Viscous clusters of fly matter pulse like auxiliary organs. Fermented sweetness curdles with arsenic dust. Mustard gas blooms softly, like a flower trying to remember war.
Everything is assembled incorrectly on purpose. Everything fits too well.
You are invited to consume it. Not listen. Not hear. Consume. The grill opens like a mouth that has outgrown its skull. Sound drips, congeals, ignites. Your guests laugh until their jaws detach. Lava, thick and neurotic, folds over them in slow affection. Their silhouettes soften, then blister, then reorganize into something edible.
Afterward: teeth. Only teeth. Hundreds of them. Thousands. Floating, rotating, gently clicking against one another in a charred field that exhales copper, antiseptic, and unfinished biology. They hum. They remember chewing something that was still thinking.
Recognition protocols initiate. A license plate pulses in the distance. It is seen through grafted infant eyes, still wet, wired directly into hypersensory receptors that cannot close. Vision becomes a wound that keeps opening. Confirmation flickers.
No alarm. No crash.
The vehicle collapses into itself like a swallowed star. Anti-impact. Anti-sound. A perfect inward violence. The surrounding world follows without resistance, peeled into a spiral that devours its own center. Even the echo refuses to survive.
plech recøveil everyone!
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Portents of a Dying Swan
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Portents of a Dying Swan is the self-titled emanation of a Montréal experimenter who answers, when the fog is right, to the name Grendel’s Mother—that perfidious, rocambolesque chimera skulking between sewer-grates and collapsing observatories. This album is less a “record” than a cracked omen, a delirious sigil pried from the jaws of an anti-world that gnaws its own viscera with shards of the mirror-between-realms.
Across its two extended descents, Portents of a Dying Swan drags the listener into dreams of dead ponds and half-rotted wetlands where impossible birds chant in languages of windburn and cosmic larvae. The music seethes with clouds split open like diseased organs, dripping luminescent vermicelli onto landscapes lined with walls of beseeching eyes—eyes begging for a void already overflowing with refuse and revelation. Desecrated candles melt upwards, as if time itself were vomiting; the earth writhes with fetid intelligence; and above it all an impious sky unfurls, populated by a million melting faces whose hollowed flesh glows with colors that should not exist and yet infect your thoughts like parasitic ideograms.
Here, absurd cockroaches of pure light jitter across the ruins of your synapses, while the scream of an imploding star is fed through broken radio bones until it births new stars—wrong stars—stars brimming with carbonic flesh-things, lopsided Shoggoths, and shards of mocking mirrors that laugh in electric dialects forgotten before they were ever spoken.
The album unfolds as a drone-somnambulism curdling into avant-garde nightmare, a fever-dream of field recordings captured from the brink of derangement. It is dark ambient embalmed inside a corpse that still moans through its split womb, nurturing within itself glittering harsh-noise insects that crawl and feed until life and death dissolve into mutually irrelevant abstractions.
Portents of a Dying Swan is not merely listened to; it is endured, inhabited, haunted by. A hallucinated scripture from a universe where decay is a sacrament, beauty is carnivorous, and music is the slow liquefaction of sanity beneath a sky that never loved you back.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Résonances oubliées sous les voûtes d'ombres de la vieille nef
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Dans la pénombre d’une ancienne église, J-S Lefantôme a tissé trois dérives sonores où les poussières des vinyles ressuscités deviennent d’obscures prières. Des Litanies d’ogues fantômes échouent sous la voûte d’une nef brisée, tandis que les trompettes étouffées, arrachés à des disques usés, se diluent sous des fréquences froides et lancinantes.
Des boucles craquelées tournent lentement, comme une triste procession religieuse. Les textures granuleuses s’enroulent autour d’un drone grave, presque immobile, qui pulse tel une chorale enfouie sous des âges de silence. À intervalles irréguliers, des fragments de mélodies oubliées surgissent, s’effritent et tombent du plafond comme une neige de poussière sur l’ancien carrelage.
-ossements
---
Vinyl dust crawls along the arches, whispers of prayers ripped from grooves that never existed. Organ litanies twist, snap, fold into themselves—then vanish. Brass murmurs rot in the corners, leaking cold frequencies that taste of ash and old blood.
Loops fracture. Loops implode. A drone pulses beneath everything, slow as rot, heavy as the silence that eats the nave from the inside. Melodies bleed through walls, shivering like insects caught in candlelight, fragments falling into the stone like teeth. The ceiling exhales; the floor shivers. Time slips sideways, dissolves, returns.
Notes become shadows. Shadows become instruments. The nave breathes with a thousand forgotten echoes, each one pregnant with absence. You move, but the sound folds around you, dragging your body into corners that were never rooms, corridors that never led anywhere, vaults that remember only the dust of voices long erased.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: SOLO PK
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A piano alone in Berlin.
A church in Cologne, breathing.
Everything Happens to Me dissolves into black air, folds of dust, a pulse that forgets itself.
The fingers move — or perhaps they dream.
Shadows hum ’Round Midnight as if the night were a slow leak in time,
and I’m in the Mood for Love becomes a mist — the memory of a melody once seen through rain.
The room is asleep.
The notes rise like moths from a grave of velvet,
pause, and fall again — patient, shimmering, vanishing.
Music is a ghost.
It is the spectral distance between a note and its echo.
A man alone in a room, finding that melody and absence share the same temperature.
Jazz stripped to its bones — a flicker of tenderness suspended in the dark.
Riveting. Beautiful. Essential. Mesmerizing.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Stone Liturgies
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
“Stone Liturgies” drifts upward like a scorched mantra from the abyssal underworld beneath Girona, where Empty Value hammers meditation into corrosion and turns contemplation into a slow-burning exorcism. Across four entranced tracks, noise becomes a form of prayer: zen-feedback spirals, molten souls dripping through fractured apertures, the anguished cry of sacred stones dreaming of their own dissolution. These are cracked litanies, wandering along the desolate ridgelines of a world long stripped of sanctity — an ebony dream erupting into roaring euphoria somewhere in the night of unmade time. The album writhes like the soundtrack to some minor hell performed by soot-eyed monks of a burning Gyuto Tantric Monastery, their chants uprooted and flung into the grasp of tentacular forces from beyond. A deep and troubling sonic affliction — the kind only Empty Value could ever summon.
The album sinks into its own grave with an enigma-track — a kind of buried dungeon-noise, writhing with blind larvae and counterfeit invitations from realms that should never answer back. It feels like a lure carved in rot, a whisper wearing another creature’s mouth.
And then the tomb cracks open again: as Empty Value's vision exhales its final dead breath.... two sprawling re-dreamings emerge—cryptic distortions birthed by the capricious UgUrGkuliktavikt, that eternal saboteur of order. He stains the sacred stone with the viscera of entropy and dreaming lunacy, rewiring the entire work into hauntological mirages: psychedelic spirals, abstract drone-noise-visions, a pair of deranged monuments where the album disintegrates into pure, shimmering madness.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: systeme
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
systeme is the celestial reactivation of relais, the sonic project of German artist T(h)om(as) Fleischhauer, originally active between 1995 and 2005 and now rising again from its upper-atmospheric ashes in the year of grace 2025. This return arrives as a quiet event of great magnitude for devotees of experimental electronic music, nocturnal ambient drones, and narcotic acousmatic drift.
Three tracks. Three systems. Three exquisite losses of orientation. Each piece unfolds as a tightly defined phantom-world with its own internal logic, yet all remain bound within a larger meta-system whose mechanisms are capricious, whose valves are metaphysical. Sound-walls assemble themselves inside an industrial-surreal structure, self-erected somewhere on Gliese 12 b, while extraterrestrial ghosts flutter through pistons and pressure chambers.
There is a voluptuous sensation of falling into a cosmic void composed of pure beauty, with the nightmare never far away, diffused, revealing a half-flesh, half-metal face without eyes. This is anti-music that radiates both warmth and cold, comfort and unease. Ambivalences multiply and propagate. Mathematical equations become crawling chimeras. Antimatter composes upon an impossible staff.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: TEETH
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
TEETH is a 28-dimensional breach into the sonic labyrinth of British sound-alchemist Steve Rufus, operating under the alias Russell’s Teapot. A hallucinatory organism rather than an album. Lysergic, unsettling, intoxicating, compulsive. Opioid nightmares rendered in radioactive color, where industrial psychedelia, witch-house residue, prog delirium, avant-noise abrasion and funereal drone-ambient coagulate into a single trembling mass.
Gigantic extraterrestrial fireflies feast on night wanderers beneath a streetlamp made of soft, flaccid flesh-confetti. Tainted surrealism. Haunted dada. A black honey distilled from bad-trip stars, an insectoid overdose of euphoria and dread. You fall into the void, then discover strata beneath the void: diffuse, humming, ether-soaked sound-matter. The skin of the dream is split open, and something syringe-like, batrachian, unspeakably alive is laid inside, writhing under a jaundiced sky of yellow, green, fuchsia and demon-light.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: The Devil's Advocates
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
“The Devil’s Advocates” is one of the latest unholy dispatches from Ontario-based hauntological sonic misfit Phibes Praetorius — one of the great unsung necromancers of occult sound collage, a spectral artisan whose music seems to crawl out of abandoned radio towers and half-collapsed séances. For years, he has haunted the periphery of ECHØVEIL’s fevered dreams, like a distant, rag-wrapped older brother to UgUrGkuliktavikt, breathing static into our lungs long before we were born.
This new abomination — ultra-distorted, psychoactive, mutilated, demented beyond the realm of polite frequencies — is as good an initiation point as any. A fissure. A wound. A doorway held open with rusted nails. The first in a series of transmissions we shall exhume.
Imagine a Gothic castle collapsing under impossible Lovecraftian angles, stones screaming as they fall. Imagine a misshapen corpse pounding on your door, grinning with gums full of rot, asking politely to be let in. Imagine the echo of the echo of the echo of a murdered choir, spinning in the void like a broken prayer wheel. Imagine black clouds forming a mouth above you, drinking your soul like a milkshake, slurping with thunderous delight. Imagine the soundtrack to an underground satanic witch-cult film no one admits to having seen — a cursed reel spliced with nightmares, Hammer Horror on PCP, delirium in film-grain.
It is grandiose. It is riveting. It is deranged fun dredged from the abyss.
A nightmare that refuses to stop giving.
A ridiculous, gorgeous, over-the-top monstrosity.
A relic of darkness.
A beacon of madness.
And above all — it is unspeakably, obscenely, deliriously GOOD.
And then —
the tape folds,
the night exhales,
the whole album seems to grin sideways at you,
as if whispering: this was only the surface… the surface of the surface… the rumor of the surface…
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: The Ghost of a Ghost (Mutated through the perception of structure kolossale)
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Released as the inaugural phantasm of this newborn label devoted to strange sonic aeons, this album marks the spectral return of The Ghost of a Ghost — originally whispered into existence on June 15, 2025 through the marvelous LOUDsilence.
loudsilencedigital.bandcamp.com/album/the-ghost-of-a-ghost
Now entirely re-dreamed, or perhaps re-nightmared, by structure kolossale — the abstract and elusive electronic entity from Montréal whose vast discography already crawls through its own labyrinth of frequencies — these three new incarnations stretch the haunted fabric of the original.
Everything breathes wider, deeper, darker: convoys of spectres exploding in a sea of extinct suns, terrestrial malaise unfurling into alien immensities. Each star moans and implodes in slow motion. Psychedelia and decay intertwine. It is a magnificent ruin, a delirious echo of its own afterlife — beautiful, exquisite, and utterly unclean.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released October 31, 2025
UgUrGkuliktavikt: voice, keyboards, piano drowned in fog and memories, field recordings scraped from impossible sceneries and haunted basements, samples stolen from history itself.
structure kolossale: electromagnetic fever, ghost dissection and many many electric ruins.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: The Laughing Halls of UGZykBriJjvNaukorG Castle
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
The weary travellers found solace in the abandoned ruins—
or thought they did—
The castle waits.
The castle eats.
The walls laugh.
They lick.
Souls of the tormented curl in the corners,
their own thoughts turning sour, feeding the stones.
—listen—
a whisper scrapes along the battlements,
something dripping down the hallways,
an echo that tastes like blood and dust.
They were eaten.
Not whole.
Not quick.
Inside their skulls, worms of unreality writhed.
They dreamed through each other,
through the mortar and the floorboards,
through the laughter that never ends.
The air is thick with absence.
A piano plays without hands.
Shadows kneel where no light falls.
The castle prays and feeds in the same gesture,
an unbroken loop,
a meal without table,
a hunger without hunger.
—who will feed it next?—
The walls are patient.
The corridors do not forgive.
The castle has learned the shape of fear,
and it reproduces it.
No one leaves.
No one survives intact.
All that remains are whispers,
incomprehensible, ecstatic, cruel,
feeding.
The weary travellers once walked these halls.
Now the halls walk inside them.
The castle laughs.
The castle eats.
And still the night goes on.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released December 16, 2025
Sir Kuliktavikt: conjurer of endless noises and unnameable others; diseased keyboards that vomit convulsions and writhing echoes; nightmares woven into the seams of decayed harmonies; desecrator of what was once beautiful music, now rendered profane and splintered; chronicler of ruin; end of report.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: The Most Unusual Voyage Of Randolph Carter
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A whisper from the threshold, a dream’s remainder still trembling in the lungs.
Rags Ov Light — also known for the spectral architectures of Ghost Light and Circle Ov Ghosts — here abandons all geography to follow Randolph Carter through the vertigo of sleep and myth.
What begins as dungeon synth, crystalline and somnambulant, soon disintegrates into dark ambient cinema — vast, airless, and unnameable. Minimal electronics drift like thoughts too faint to surface. The music does not unfold so much as leak, like candlelight through the cracks of a forgotten temple.
Each track is a door. Each door opens inward.
The traveller’s soul hums in low frequencies, guided by dreams of impossible suns.
There are no choruses here, no endings — only corridors of echo, haunted by Lovecraft’s ghost and Carter’s endless voyage beyond the veil.
A masterpiece of the Cthulhu mythos, and a privilege to let it breathe — and decay — within the vaults of ECHØVEIL RECORDS.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
--------
THE STORY:
Wherein our legendary protagonist and Dreamer rivaled only by the Great Kuranes himself passes out beyond the boundaries of Earth's Dreamlands through the vast gulfs of space to explore the even Stranger dreams of alien stars.
********************************************
The Unusual Voyage - Wherein our protagonist and hero Randolph Carter, the greatest of Earths Dreamers save for the Legendary King Kuranes himself, boards a mysterious silver galleon bound for distant alien shores. Through the milky way and beyond.
Through Astral Tides Upon Lunar Shores - Wherein the mysterious silver galleon puts into port upon the dark side of the moon, which just so happens to be but a stones throw away from Earth's Dreamlands. Where our protagonist outsmarts some moonbeasts, with the help of some far out cats and procures a most wondrous and sacred Soma, said to be the extraction of Earth's dreams and a most particular ambrosia and delicacy of the Gods, for what are dreams but hoped fors and silent prayers, before setting off again on towards farther ports.
Beyond The Moon - On past Neptune with Her frozen spires and sentient fungi born aloft by the wind. On past Fabled Yuggoth Herself, the Underworld and Library of the Elder Gods, the home of the fungal record keepers of Time's arcane eddies and warfs, deeper into the deepest realms of Cosmic sleep.where no Dreamer, even King Kuranes himself, is known to have gone before.
The Gulf Of Astral Sleep - What unholy vastness of celestial void where formless things gibber and howl, the silver galleon plowed on towards the furthest reaches of Dream and alien dawns.
Strange Dreams From A Dark Star - Towards what Cosmic Hells the galleon drifted, far beyond all known galaxies uncharted deep within the starless void of deepest space and time. What alien dreams slither forth from that black hole, that final stargate, ancient beyond ancient, primordial Gods of Madness stalk the spaces between giving birth to unimaginable and unlimited nightmare horrors. The silver ship of fools pushed on through the wiell of deepest night...
Where Outer Gods Dwell - Through the graveside beyond time, beyond the Ultimate Gate, the Last Void, deep within, beside and beyond the furthest unnamed gulf... The Outer Gods! What sacred and Mystical Horrors these unknowable transcendent Nightmares and Dark Effulgent Deities of Dream... Ever beyond yet whispering Their unearthly songs to madmen on lonely mountaintops beyond the cold Wastes of Dreamland and from the odd non-euclidean angles and shadows of their fevered and unholy visions...
The Record From Yuggoth - Wherein we conclude our story and some archeologists find a mysterious wax cylinder of unknown and alien origin deep within an Australian desert believed to be the final testament of Randolph Carter narrating his most unusual exodus through the Outer Dreamlands and Beyond.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: The Vision of Saint Francis of Assisi
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
I try to capture Saint Francis in one of his ecstatic visions. The sound is brittle, close to breaking, crackling. Through Grace, Francis is allowed to hold the Christ Child.. the Blessed Mother looks upon Francis with Pure Love. Francis is holding the Living God, who allows Himself to be helpless..
Here we have my attempt to explore unimaginable beauty through textured minimal sound. I wish you Goodness.
-Saint Elisabeth
---
The Vision of Saint Francis of Assisi marks the beginning of a new ECHØVEIL series devoted to the back catalogue of one of the most singular and essential voices to emerge from experimental noise in recent years: Saint Elisabeth.
The Vision was my first passage into the quietly immense world of Saint Elisabeth, and it remains a profound privilege to be able to share this work. Across eighteen minutes, it unfolds as an experience of ethereal, ambient, and minimal noise that invites meditation rather than spectacle. It is a music of gathering and release, of questioning and inward listening, of emptiness edged with moments of fragile euphoria.
What descends upon the listener feels less like sound than a fine rain of silvered metal, falling slowly, insistently, until even the most imploring interior spaces begin to soften and glow.
There is nothing else that sounds quite like this. In his search for the divine within noise, Saint Elisabeth touches something rare: a form of transcendence that does not announce itself, but hums softly at the edge of perception. Beautiful without ornament. Severe without cruelty. Essential. Prodigious.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released December 30, 2025

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: THUMPER
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
THUMPER rises like an unnamed organ from the abyss, pulsing with the delirious heartbeat of THE GOLDEN SPIRAL—Porlie Eidolon’s secret conduit. In this project, fragments of the world—field hiss, bowed shadows of corroded instruments, scavenged echoes from obsolete machines—are rearranged into post-modernist rituals, neoclassical specters, ambient phantoms gasping through broken movements.
Released on the artist’s birthday, THUMPER unfolds as a birth-wound, a spiral-shaped breach in reality. Here, nightmares glide with a morbid grace, brushing against the listener’s soul like the wings of some patient abyssal creature. Fog becomes memory; memory becomes myth; myth collapses into a labyrinth of sound where impossible monuments rise—sonic clouds ossified into unholy geometry.
Across two immense, abstract, cinematic incantations, THUMPER whispers its doctrine of fragmented unreason: shards of occult films that never existed, reels burned by time, murmurs from dying elements and collapsing horizons. It is a pilgrimage into the drowned edges of consciousness, where beauty and decay coil together, inseparable, trembling in the spiral’s cold light.
Fun for the WHOLE family!
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released December 18, 2025
THE GOLDEN SPIRAL: every sound, every nightmare, every dream
thegoldenspiral1.bandcamp.com
----
THE GOLDEN SPIRAL is the current project from Porlie Eidolon of Fleaspit and Spindly Killers.
The project uses pre-existing elements from multiple sources along with Field Recordings, Violin and Bowed Bass Guitar to build Post-Modernist, Neoclassical/Ambient pieces- generally structured as either multiple movement compositions, or as stand-alone works.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Tombs
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
"Tombs" by Needles is a sonic procession for liquefied crypts and worm-eaten memories. Dungeon synth or dungeon noise? It hardly matters — here, everything collapses, fades, and erodes beneath the bite of a wind no longer of this world. A wind that reeks of exhumed soil, spoiled humus, and phosphorescent white grubs writhing through the nerves of a stillborn dream.
The keyboards stagger, breathless, like black candles flickering in a bottomless nave. Wails spiral, unplaceable noises crawl along the inner walls, childhood nightmares stretch and mutate into vaporous ogres.
In three serpentine sub-movements, Tombs unfurls its sooty litany, woven from false comforts and too-damp truths. Each note is a skeletal finger brushing your spine, each breath a whisper from the void calling out your name.
Tombs is not really music... It’s the ground opening beneath your feet, faintly resonant, ready to swallow your soul for eternity.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released November 17, 2025
Initially released on May 5th 2023.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Tunneling
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A single descent. Twenty-two minutes of collapsing matter, of steel lungs and corroded neurons grinding against the bone of time. Tunneling was recorded two years ago in the stagnant hum of Peoria, Illinois — but it feels older, like the sound of Nikola Tesla in awe, experimenting with his electrical discharge tubes one damp summer night.
This is harsh noise as hypnosis — trance born from abrasion. The frequencies shimmer like molten glass; textures breathe and suffocate, everything vibrating between pain and revelation. Woods Mattress digs through layers of decay and electricity until only pulse remains — primitive, physical, infinitely abstract.
An astonishing work of sonic erosion: one track, one wound, one endless tunnel through the skull.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Under the weight of the dead sun
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Oh, this is the good stuff. The kind that pulls you into that special place where pain and joy collapse into one.
Experimental DooooOOOOOooooooOOOOOm-drone metal of the highest caliber.
The material here is viscous. Doom stretched past genre into substance. Notes do not begin or end; they secrete. Feedback flows like sap from a wounded amplifier: slow, adhesive, almost tender. One does not listen. One is coated.
Voluptuous languor. Ecstatic suffering. A euphoria that does not rise but sinks, deeper, warmer, more irreversible. Psychedelia without color, or rather: color seen through closed eyelids, pulsing in red-black tides.
Comparative structures (approximate, unstable):
Sunn O))) — amplification as monolith, but here softened, made febrile.
Cathedral — ritual heaviness, re-liquefied.
Eyehategod — filth transmuted into narcotic clarity.
Om — repetition as prayer, the deity absent.
Kyuss — desert heat, slowed until it congeals.
Boris — mutation, continuous, cellular.
Earth — time flattened into a horizon.
Corrupted — despair architected in low frequencies.
Electric Wizard — intoxication ritualized, thickened.
Melvins (Lysol phase) — abrasion as texture.
Sleep (Jerusalem) — pilgrimage extended beyond destination.
But this is not synthesis. It is pressure convergence. A storm slowed to near immobility: psychedelic hail suspended mid-fall, each fragment humming.
The listener reports:
• irises flooded, oversaturated, unable to close
• tympanic membranes strained, then opened, then rewritten
• bodily heaviness reinterpreted as pleasure
• time perceived as a thick, liquid column, descending
Feedback becomes vegetal. It grows. It wraps around the skeletal frame of the compositions, not choking but adorning. Pain is not removed, only rendered exquisite.
There is mastery here, but concealed. Nothing hurried. Everything allowed to ferment. The music takes its time the way a wound takes its time: slowly, methodically, beautifully refusing closure.
Under this dead sun, decay is not an end state but a method of illumination.
- Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Under Willow's Warmth
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
This is an era where sound replaces scripture. Drone seeps through stone walls like miasma, raw black metal crackles like signal fires seen through cataracts, and doom ambient hangs in the air with the weight of funeral incense left to rot. The music does not advance. It circles, presses, hypnotizes, as if time itself had been wounded and now leaks slowly into the soil.
The landscapes it summons are intra-terrestrial, buried beneath any notion of sky. Forests sweat mist thick enough to erase geometry. Caves function as organs. Villages exist only as afterimages, already abandoned. Soldiers roam without wars, holding their own entrails in numb hands, less to survive than to delay collapse. Trees murmur apocalyptic litanies in a language older than prayer, their roots tangled with bones and rusted tools whose purposes have been forgotten.
Plague is no longer an event but a climate. Blood darkens everything it touches. Flesh splits not violently but inevitably, as if obeying a long-postponed command. Hooded figures drift through the haze, neither priests nor sorcerers, merely administrators of decay, recording nothing, preserving nothing. Death persists everywhere, not as an ending, but as a background condition: grinning softly, teeth eroded, endlessly patient.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released February 2, 2026

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Unquiet Hearing
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
It does not seek traditional harmony, nor rely on abstract imagination, it presents the existence of sound itself.
Sounds are constantly interrupted and reorganized between silence and eruption.
Each track of the album reflects the absurdity of reality, order and chaos intertwine, meaning is temporarily stripped away, leaving only direct perception and space.
This is not a pursuit of beauty, but an observation of existence and absurdity, attempting to render the fragmentation and disorder of everyday life.
-Solstice D’hive
---
Sometimes, from the void, an album latches onto your mind like a lucid fever, a pulse of unearthly light threading through the cavities of your soul. Unquiet Hearing is such a phantom: pure, unhinged, deliriously alive, a labyrinth of sound that refuses to be tamed. Solstice D’hive conjures here a world both exquisite and slightly nightmarish, a reflection of the mind untethered, a mirror to your own hidden unrest.
Free jazz detonates against spectral chamber-classical edifices; folk whispers melt into your being like liquid memory; ambient-noisy gusts tear through perception, unraveling what you thought was solid. Each fragment, each fleeting motif, is a secret, personal, intimate—an emotive shard of absolute truth.
This album could very well become your austere confidant, your bedside oracle, your midnight companion. It nourishes the mind with impossible beauties, saturates the cortex with ecstatic sonic madness, and leaves your senses trembling in the afterglow of audacious creativity.
In these dizzying, vertiginous miniatures, Solstice D’hive navigates a cosmos of influences: the violent precision of Naked City, the chambered folk mysticism of Rachel’s, the intricate RIO labyrinths of Henry Cow, pianistic eruptions worthy of McCoy Tyner and Cecil Taylor, the relentless ingenuity of Eric Dolphy, the madcap extravagances of Béla Bartók, the obtuse raw emotion of Martha Argerich, a hyper-tonal Steve Reich reincarnated as surreal jazzman, Alamaailman Vasarat wandering on Pluto, Satie growing mist-fungi in gardens of liquid stars, The Seatbelts dreaming a night in Andromeda…
Each note is a ripple in the strange architecture of your psyche. Each silence is a wound or a sanctuary. Unquiet Hearing is not merely listened to—it is inhabited, a landscape of delirium, devotion, and unrestrained wonder.
-Sir Kuliktavikt
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.credits:
released December 13, 2025
Solstice D’hive: piano from fevered voids, winds that moan with alien articulations, strings that opens portals to new dimensions, percussions that fracture reality, and woven tapestries of uncertainty and ecstatic confusion.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Unsharpened Blades
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A ritual performed on rusted speakers.
Unsharpened Blades beats, limps, convulses — a percussive delirium stitched from tabla remains, found metal, and the breath of extinct radio towers.
The rhythm is alive, but diseased — joyous, broken, euphoric in its decay.
Tribal ghosts crash their drums against digital cliffs; tempo multiplies, dissolves, reforms in spasms of molten pattern.
Field recordings spill like mercury — footsteps, whispers, the pulse of cities drowned beneath dream static.
A phantom organ bleeds through the mist, weaving hymns for circuits and shadows. Voices flicker between tongues, possessed by the mechanical gods of sleep deprivation.
Every vibration feels ceremonial, as if the machines are learning to pray again — not for clarity, but for noise, for rupture, for transformation.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Unspoken
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Page 1 (missing).
Page 2 begins mid-sentence:
…microtonal lattices, improperly tempered, proliferate like numerical mold. Frequencies do not align but insist. Each interval a misprint. Each chord a typesetting error left uncorrected, deliberately or otherwise.
The apparatus hums.
Not music in the civil sense. Rather: a series of measurements conducted by an operator exhibiting advanced signs of cognitive drift. Notes taken in the margins contradict the main text. Footnotes metastasize. Parentheses open and never return.
Dungeon synth reduced to mnemonic debris.
Compare (inadvisable) with:
EarthBound — affective naïveté inverted, organs exposed, circuitry dreaming.
The Residents — identity dissolved into method.
Pierre Henry — sound as specimen, dissected mid-vibration.
Mortiis — medieval memory decomposed into tonal sediment.
But these are only approximations. The present document rejects lineage.
—
Section III: On Sleep Deprivation as Compositional Engine
Observation: extended wakefulness produces micro-deviations in pitch perception.
Corollary: these deviations, when systematized, generate new harmonic grammars.
Addendum (handwritten, erratic): grammar is a disease.
The pieces within Unspoken unfold as if derived from such a state. Repetition without reassurance. Patterns that almost stabilize, then tilt, then fracture. A melodic line appears, briefly legible, before dissolving into a swarm of adjacent frequencies, each one slightly incorrect, collectively undeniable.
—
Appendix A: Phenomenology of Listening
The listener reports:
• a sensation of spatial compression (air thickened to gel)
• auditory afterimages persisting beyond source material
• involuntary internal harmonization attempts (unsuccessful)
• low-grade existential misalignment
In certain passages, the sound does not progress but accumulates, like dust inside a closed instrument. Time ceases to function linearly. Instead: stratification. Layers of near-silence pressing against one another.
—
Errata:
There are no errors.
Or rather: the errors are the system.
—
Final note (unsigned):
What cannot be spoken does not remain silent. It migrates. It encodes itself in frequency, in deviation, in the infinitesimal distance between two pitches that refuse reconciliation.
-Sir Kuliktavikt???&%$$*$*%$%(xf¨_)

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: untitled
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
A soundless omen.
A wound opened again in the firmament.
After the first leakage of sound, conjured in communion with UgUrGkuliktavikt, engineer of the abyss...
The signal returns — weaker, stranger, clothed in strings that shimmer like veins under frost. The black ambient core remains: eroded, unholy, raw beyond recognition. Yet something learned has begun to breathe beneath it — a neoclassical fracture, an alien grace leaking through the static.
This is the residue of something thought extinct. A posthumous architecture, built from rotting harmonies and magnetic ash. It does not begin or end — it drifts, implodes, reforms like a mind looping its own decay.
You listen, but you are not the listener.
You are the medium.
You are the altar.
The pulse enters through the skull — viscous, endless — and you remember that silence was never empty. It was waiting.
And now, it swallows you again.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: untitled
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
The signal returns yet again, distorted, reborn, crawling sideways through cracked speakers and dead prayers. The sound is no longer a sound but an infection of structure, a cathedral folding into its own echo, an eye that eats its reflection.
Notes melt.
Time exhales.
Something tries to remember its own disappearance.
This second Untitled doesn’t continue — it mutates. It arrives already decomposed, rewriting itself while you listen.
The air smells like burning parchment, and still the transmission persists, climbing the walls, whispering through the holes in perception: who sent this? what organ receives it?
You think you understand, but then the room bends, syntax collapses, the language forgets its alphabet. Meaning is devoured by resonance.
And in the center of that black pulse —
not revelation,
not void,
just the endless trembling of being heard by something that does not exist.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Vehement Blizzard Destruction
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Vehement Blizzard Destruction is a riddle of ice whispered by Thorns + Compost—a Christian Harsh Noise Wall apparition where nature itself seems to remember forgotten gospels. It is a single twenty-minute whiteout, a hymn unraveling inside a storm that does not want to end, a scripture buried in static that only the cold can read.
The lone track unspools like a storm sent to test wandering souls: a catastrophic blizzard tunneling through the senses, conjuring visions of Paysage d’Hiver collapsing into The Rita’s abyssal frequencies.
Buried within the static, screams flare like desperate prayers caught in the gale—first terrifying, then strangely consoling, as if the mountain itself were grieving in tongues. Over time, something shifts in the listener’s journey: those vocals seem to dissolve into an ambient, spectral rhythm, a trance-current that numbs and awakens simultaneously.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Veils Falling - A Young Person's Guide to ECHØVEIL
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
To celebrate the first month of ECHØVEIL’s strange and shimmering existence, the excellent, prolific, Athens-based conjuror Substak offers an exquisite mixtape—an oneiric map of the label’s hidden corridors, etched in frequencies and ghost-dust. Here, the master guides us through a spectral pilgrimage: cinematic Lovecraftian dungeon synth dissolving into dim alcoves; abstract noise walls re-sculpted by phantom hands into hauntological drone; psychedelic avant-rock drifting like a fever dream through catnip-scented vapours; post-industrial hymns half-rotted and drowning beneath dark-ambient liturgies of abandonment; minimalist Lynchian drone-doom exhaled directly from the mist; and space-ambient elegies where stars die in unimaginable slow motion, collapsing into velvet silence.
Thank you, Substak, for this unholy gift of sound.
And by the way—this release is completely (and utterly) free. ENJOY.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Veils Falling II - A Middle-Aged Person's Guide to ECHØVEIL
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
My dear friend Substak is back at it again.
Veils Falling II – A Middle-Aged Person’s Guide to ECHØVEIL is what happens when the fog never lifts, but you’ve learned how to move through it by touch, memory, and mild intuition, without smashing your knees on the furniture.
Welcome to the ECHØVEIL mansion, where every room hums with strange foreign sounds, both soothing and deeply suspicious. Substak leads the way through the half-dark, a courteous guide in a place that may or may not exist. You will wander impossible corridors inhabited by ghostly sonic entities, descend into basements populated by gigantic anthropomorphic rats (pure Bruno Mattei energy), and cross paths with oddly mellow psychedelic vampires who mostly just want to talk.
If you’re lucky, you may even be allowed to inspect Sir Kuliktavikt’s coffin, slightly ajar, vibrating softly.
Enjoy this carte de visite: part deux.
And yes, this release is 100% FREE. Download it, get lost, and don’t worry: the house remembers you.

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Veils Falling III – A Mature Listener’s Guide to ECHØVEIL
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
REJOICE MY LOVELY GHOULS !!
Our accomplice Substak returns, dragging behind him a fresh volume in the Veils Falling series.
Within these reels and ruins: free-jazz and avant-chamber-prog spiraling like ivy through abandoned conservatories; hauntological tape loops of unsettling grace; haunted-church drones swelling beneath collapsed altars; minimalist noise walls that do not merely tear at the soul, but patiently disassemble it, brick by trembling brick. Cinematic horror soundscapes ooze in ultra-surreal hues, while maximalist avant-garde plunderphonics gnaw at their own reflections. Somewhere below it all, deconstructed, noisy, vampiric dungeon synth crawls on its elbows, thirsty and smiling.
Fun for all families.
Even the extinct ones.
And like all the other "VEILS FALLING" entries, this one is 100% FREE !

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Vimanah III
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
This project is based on music, which is said to be occult and very ancient. Some would call it intelligent music. Ragas can be considered a form of ritual, both for the listener and the performer, using this vehicle to get as close as possible to their inner self. This vehicle, these vimanas, are a way to traverse time and space, sometimes even amidst intense noise, as well as during very moderate vibrations. I used rock and ambient drone music to get as close as possible to the phenomenon of raga.
-Vimanah
---
This night will swallow you.
Tired souls flicker through it, wavering like orphaned flames, grieving without memory of what was lost. A primordial drone hums beneath everything, older than language, older than stone. Meditation shaped like nothingness. A descent to the center of everything, where centuries crumble into powder and epochs that never existed leave their fingerprints on the air.
Dead ragas drift toward uncertain elsewhere.
The beauty and abrasion of terminal cities breathe through cracked concrete. Columns of shadow-birds plunge from invisible rafters, feeding on the ecstatic ribs of the expiring.
An infinite dormitory awaits. Lichen and moss carpeting its corridors. Euphoria fossilized in patience. Bone stacked beside forgotten recollections. Sleep without dreams, yet saturated with them.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

ECHØVEIL RECORDS.title: Why Die? (an uncommon question)
ECHØVEIL RECORDS.about:
Why die.
Why die when the room is still breathing, when the walls have not finished learning your name.
The call comes anyway. Not a scream. A syrupy hum. The exhaust pipe purring like a lover beneath the spine. Hands busy with crushed mirrors in a basement where a single candle wheezes out dead hymns, each note older than memory, each note designed by an architect who was never born and therefore never stopped building.
Soot speaks. The prophet descends upward downward upward. Knees shiver. Time slows. CRACK. Sound breaks a bone somewhere far away.
Dolls rot in Mexican trees.
A furnace room under a primary school in Silent Hill keeps its mouth open.
Shadows practice entering me.
Soul pain. The blues.
I punch rusted bicycles. The phone rings inside a corroded underground booth. I am afraid to answer. I answer.
It is me. On the other end. Mouth full of black soil. Laughing. The laughter crawls out and becomes luminous cockroaches.
A new state of matter. Recycled plastic. Glassy. Clean. It announces the death of the entire football team. Ebola sunlight. They melted politely.
I shoulder a backpack stuffed with wrong noises, strangled cries, impossible snakes. I go home. Head down.
Why die.
Why die.
-Sir Kuliktavikt

existent/nonexistent is a sound artist/experimental musician, audio engineer and photographer based out of Canada. existent/nonexistent creates his ‘musical’ pieces and soundscapes at his studio, Abattoir Studios, in Victoria, BC, Canada.
existent/nonexistent uses a wide variety of synthesizers, organs/keyboards, samplers, found sounds, field recordings, feedback, contact microphone noise box, prepared guitar, electric guitar and bass, piano and theremin in his musical pieces.
existent/nonexistent transcends all musical genres from: sound art, sound collage, musique concrete, experimental, electro-acoustic, noise, noise rock, lowercase, drone/ ambient and minimalism.
